summary.long: Genesis is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the earth was formless and empty, and darkness was over the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the surface of the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be light!” And there was light.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God saw the light, that it was good, and God caused there to be a separation between the light and between the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And there was evening and there was morning, the first day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be a vaulted dome in the midst of the waters, and let it cause a separation between the waters.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God made the vaulted dome, and he caused a separation between the waters which were under the vaulted dome and between the waters which were over the vaulted dome. And it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God called the vaulted dome “heaven.” And there was evening, and there was morning, a second day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the waters under heaven be gathered to one place, and let the dry ground appear.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God called the dry ground “earth,” and he called the collection of the waters “seas.” And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the earth produce green plants that will bear seed—fruit trees bearing fruit in which there is seed—according to its kind, on the earth.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And the earth brought forth green plants bearing seed according to its kind, and trees bearing fruit in which there was seed according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was evening and there was morning, a third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be lights in the vaulted dome of heaven to separate day from night, and let them be as signs and for appointed times, and for days and years,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and they shall be as lights in the vaulted dome of heaven to give light on the earth.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God made two lights, the greater light to rule the day and the smaller light to rule the night, and the stars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God placed them in the vaulted dome of heaven to give light on the earth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly over the earth across the face of the vaulted dome of heaven.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God created the great sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarm, according to their kind, and every bird with wings according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds multiply on the earth.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And there was evening, and there was morning, a fifth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the earth bring forth living creatures according to their kind: cattle and moving things, and wild animals according to their kind.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God made wild animals according to their kind and the cattle according to their kind, and every creeping thing of the earth according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let us make humankind in our image and according to our likeness, and let them rule over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of heaven, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every moving thing that moves upon the earth.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God created humankind in his image, in the likeness of God he created him, male and female he created them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed them, and God said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth and subdue it, and rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of heaven, and over every animal that moves upon the earth.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God said, “Look—I am giving to you every plant that bears seed which is on the face of the whole earth, and every kind of tree that bears fruit. They shall be yours as food.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And to every kind of animal of the earth and to every bird of heaven, and to everything that moves upon the earth in which there is life I am giving every green plant as food.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God saw everything that he had made and, behold, it was very good. And there was evening, and there was morning, a sixth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And heaven and earth and all their array were finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the seventh day God finished his work that he had done, and he rested on the seventh day from all his work that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed the seventh day, and he sanctified it, because on it he rested from all his work of creating that there was to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of heaven and earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made earth and heaven—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: before any plant of the field was on earth, and before any plant of the field had sprung up, because Yahweh God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was no human being to cultivate the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but a stream would rise from the earth and water the whole face of the ground—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when Yahweh God formed the man of dust from the ground, and he blew into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God planted a garden in Eden in the east, and there he put the man whom he had formed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God caused to grow every tree that was pleasing to the sight and good for food. And the tree of life was in the midst of the garden, along with the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a river flowed out from Eden that watered the garden, and from there it diverged and became four branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the first is the Pishon. It went around all the land of Havilah, where there is gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The gold of that land is good; bdellium and onyx stones are there.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the second is Gihon. It went around all the land of Cush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the third is Tigris. It flows east of Assyria. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God took the man and set him in the garden of Eden to cultivate it and to keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, “From every tree of the garden you may freely eat,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: but from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat, for in the day that you eat from it you shall surely die.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then Yahweh God said, “it is not good that the man is alone. I will make for him a helper as his counterpart.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And out of the ground Yahweh God formed every beast of the field and every bird of the sky, and he brought each to the man to see what he would call it. And whatever the man called that living creature was its name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man gave names to every domesticated animal and to the birds of heaven and to all the wild animals. But for the man there was not found a helper as his counterpart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man. While he slept, he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh where it had been.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God fashioned the rib which he had taken from the man into a woman and brought her to the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the man said,
“She is now bone from my bones
    and flesh from my flesh;
she shall be called ‘Woman,’
    for she was taken from man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and shall cling to his wife, and they shall be as one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man and his wife, both of them, were naked, and they were not ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the serpent was more crafty than any other wild animal which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, “Did God indeed say, ‘You shall not eat from any tree in the garden’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to the serpent, “From the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but from the tree that is in the midst of the garden, God said, ‘You shall not eat from it, nor shall you touch it, lest you die’.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the serpent said to the woman, “You shall not surely die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God knows that on the day you both eat from it, then your eyes will be opened and you both shall be like gods, knowing good and evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food and that it was a delight to the eyes, and the tree was desirable to make one wise, then she took from its fruit and she ate. And she gave it also to her husband with her, and he ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eyes of both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked. And they sewed together fig leaves and they made for themselves coverings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they heard the sound of Yahweh God walking in the garden at the windy time of day. And the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God called to the man and said to him, “Where are you?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And he replied, “I heard the sound of you in the garden, and I was afraid because I am naked, so I hid myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree from which I forbade you to eat?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And the man replied, “The woman whom you gave to be with me—she gave to me from the tree and I ate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh God said to the woman, “What is this you have done?” And the woman said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
Then Yahweh God said to the serpent,
“Because you have done this,
    you will be cursed
    more than any domesticated animal
    and more than any wild animal.
On your belly you shall go
    and dust you shall eat
    all the days of your life.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
And I will put hostility
    between you and between the woman,
    and between your offspring and between her offspring;
he will strike you on the head,
    and you will strike him on the heel.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
To the woman he said,
“I will greatly increase
    your pain in childbearing;
    in pain you shall bear children.
And to your husband shall be your desire.
    And he shall rule over you.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
And to Adam he said, “Because you listened to the voice of your wife and you ate from the tree from which I forbade you to eat,
the ground shall be cursed on your account.
    In pain you shall eat from it
    all the days of your life.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
And thorns and thistles shall sprout for you,
    and you shall eat the plants of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator
God

verses.text: And the man named his wife Eve, because she was the mother of all life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin, and he clothed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh God said, “Look—the man has become as one of us, to know good and evil. What if he stretches out his hand and takes also from the tree of life and eats, and lives forever?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Yahweh God sent him out from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from which he was taken.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So he drove the man out, and placed cherubim east of the garden of Eden, and a flaming, turning sword to guard the way to the tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Adam knew Eve his wife, and she conceived and bore Cain. And she said, “I have given birth to a man with the help of Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she bore his brother Abel. And Abel became a keeper of sheep, and Cain became a tiller of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the course of time Cain brought an offering from the fruit of the ground to Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Abel also brought an offering from the choicest firstlings of his flock. And Yahweh looked with favor to Abel and to his offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to Cain and to his offering he did not look with favor. And Cain became very angry, and his face fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Cain, “Why are you angry, and why is your face fallen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do well will I not accept you? But if you do not do well, sin is crouching at the door. And its desire is for you, but you must rule over it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Cain said to his brother Abel, “Let us go out into the field.” And when they were in the field, Cain rose up against his brother Abel and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Cain, “Where is Abel your brother?” And he said, “I do not know; am I my brother’s keeper?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “What have you done? The voice of your brother’s blood is crying out to me from the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now you are cursed from the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive the blood of your brother from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you till the ground it shall no longer yield its strength to you. You shall be a wanderer and a fugitive on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cain said to Yahweh, “My punishment is greater than I can bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, you have driven me out today from the face of the ground, and from your face I must hide. I will be a wanderer and a fugitive on the earth, and it will happen that whoever finds me will kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to him, “Therefore, whoever kills Cain will be avenged sevenfold.” Then Yahweh put a sign on Cain so that whoever found him would not kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cain went out from the presence of Yahweh, and he settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to Enoch. And when he built a city he named the city after his son, Enoch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Enoch was born Irad, and Irad fathered Mehujael, and Mehujael fathered Methushael, and Methushael fathered Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lamech took to himself two wives. The name of the first was Adah, and the name of the second was Zillah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adah gave birth to Jabal; he was the father of those who live in tents and those who have livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of his brother was Jubal; he was the father of all who play stringed instruments and wind instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zillah also gave birth to Tubal-Cain who forged all kinds of tools of bronze and iron. And the sister of Tubal-Cain was Naamah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Lamech said to his wives,
“Adah and Zillah, listen to my voice;
    O wives of Lamech, hear my words.
I have killed a man for wounding me,
    Even a young man for injuring me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If Cain is avenged sevenfold,
    Then Lamech will be avenged seventy and seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Adam knew his wife again, and she gave birth to a son. And she called his name Seth, for she said “God has appointed to me another child in the place of Abel, because Cain killed him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for Seth, he also fathered a son, and he called his name Enosh. At that time he began to call on the name of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the record of the generations of Adam. When God created Adam, he made him in the likeness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Male and female he created them. And he blessed them. And he called their name “Humankind” when they were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Adam had lived one hundred and thirty years, he fathered a child in his likeness, according to his image. And he called his name Seth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the days of Adam after he fathered Seth were eight hundred years. And he fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Adam which he lived were nine hundred and thirty years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Seth had lived one hundred and five years, he fathered Enosh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Seth had fathered Enosh he lived eight hundred and seven years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Enosh lived ninety years, he fathered Kenan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Enosh fathered Kenan he lived eight hundred and fifteen years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Enosh were nine hundred and five years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Kenan had lived seventy years, he fathered Mahalalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Kenan had fathered Mahalalel, he lived eight hundred and forty years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Kenan were nine hundred and ten years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Mahalalel had lived sixty-five years, he fathered Jared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Mahalalel had fathered Jared, he lived eight hundred and thirty years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred and ninety-five years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jared had lived one hundred and sixty-two years, he fathered Enoch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Jared had fathered Enoch, he lived eight hundred years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred and sixty-two years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Enoch had lived sixty-five years, he fathered Methuselah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Enoch walked with God after he fathered Methuselah three hundred years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred and sixty-five years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Enoch walked with God, and he was no more, for God took him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Methuselah had lived one hundred and eighty-seven years, he fathered Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Methuselah had fathered Lamech, he lived seven hundred and eighty-two years, and fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred and sixty-nine years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Lamech had lived one hundred and eighty-two years, he fathered a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called his name Noah, saying, “This one shall relieve us from our work, and from the hard labor of our hands, from the ground which Yahweh had cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Lamech had fathered Noah he lived five hundred and ninety-five years, and he fathered sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of Lamech were seven hundred and seventy-seven years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Noah was five hundred years old, Noah fathered Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that, when humankind began to multiply on the face of the ground, daughters were born to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of God saw the daughters of humankind, that they were beautiful. And they took for themselves wives from all that they chose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said, “My Spirit shall not abide with humankind forever in that he is also flesh. And his days shall be one hundred and twenty years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Nephilim were upon the earth in those days, and also afterward, when the sons of God went into the daughters of humankind, and they bore children to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh saw that the evil of humankind was great upon the earth, and every inclination of the thoughts of his heart was always only evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh regretted that he had made humankind on the earth, and he was grieved in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said, “I will destroy humankind whom I created from upon the face of the earth, from humankind, to animals, to creeping things, and to the birds of heaven, for I regret that I have made them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Noah found favor in the eyes of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, without defect in his generations. Noah walked with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah fathered three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the earth was corrupted before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God saw the earth, and behold, it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted its way upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Noah, “The end of all flesh has come before me, for the earth was filled with violence because of them. Now, look, I am going to destroy them along with the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make for yourself an ark of cypress wood; you must make the ark with rooms, then you must cover it with pitch, inside and outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is how you must make it: the length of the ark, three hundred cubits; its width fifty cubits; its height, thirty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must make a roof for the ark, and finish it to a cubit above. And as for the door of the ark, you must put it in its side. You must make it with a lower, second, and a third deck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, behold, I am about to bring the flood waters over the earth to destroy all flesh in which is the breath of life from under the heaven; everything that is on the earth shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will establish my covenant with you, and you must go into the ark—you, and your sons, and your wife, and the wives of your sons with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of every living thing, from all flesh, you must bring two from every kind into the ark to keep them alive with you; they shall be male and female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the birds according to their kind, and from the animals according to their kind, from every creeping thing on the ground according to its kind—two from every kind shall come to you to keep them alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for you, take for yourself from every kind of food that is eaten. And you must gather it to yourself. And it shall be for you and for them for food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah did according to all that God commanded him; thus he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Noah, “Go—you and all your household—into the ark, for I have seen you are righteous before me in this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From all the clean animals you must take for yourself seven pairs, a male and its mate. And from the animals that are not clean you must take two, a male and its mate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as from the birds of heaven seven pairs, male and female, to keep their kind alive on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For within seven days I will send rain upon the earth for forty days and forty nights. And I will blot out all the living creatures that I have made from upon the face of the ground.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah did according to all that Yahweh commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood waters came upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah and his sons and his wife, and the wives of his sons with him, went into the ark because of the waters of the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of clean animals, and of animals which are not clean, and of the birds, and everything that creeps upon the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two of each went to Noah, into the ark, male and female, as God had commanded Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after seven days the waters of the flood came over the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the six hundredth year of the life of Noah, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month—on that day all the springs of the great deep were split open, and the windows of heaven were opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rain came upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this same day, Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and the wife of Noah and the three wives of his sons with them, went into the ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they and all the living creatures according to their kind, and all the domesticated animals according to their kind, and all the creatures that creep upon the earth according to their kind, all the birds according to their kind, every winged creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Noah to the ark, two of each, from every living thing in which was the breath of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that came, male and female, of every living thing, came as God had commanded him. And Yahweh shut the door behind him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the flood came forty days and forty nights upon the earth. And the waters increased, and lifted the ark, and it rose up from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters prevailed and increased greatly upon the earth. And the ark went upon the surface of the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters prevailed overwhelmingly upon the earth, and they covered all the high mountains which were under the entire heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters swelled fifteen cubits above the mountains, covering them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every living thing that moved on the earth perished—the birds, and the domesticated animals, and the wild animals, and everything that swarmed on the earth, and all humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything in whose nostrils was the breath of life, among all that was on dry land, died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he blotted out every living thing upon the surface of the ground, from humankind, to animals, to creeping things, and to the birds of heaven; they were blotted out from the earth. Only Noah and those who were with him in the ark remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters prevailed over the earth one hundred and fifty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God remembered Noah and all the wild animals, and all the domesticated animals that were with him in the ark. And God caused a wind to blow over the earth, and the waters subsided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fountains of the deep and the windows of the heavens were closed, and the rain from the heavens was restrained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters receded from the earth gradually, and the waters abated at the end of one hundred and fifty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ark came to rest in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the mountains of Ararat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters continued to recede to the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first of the month, the tops of the mountains appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that at the end of forty days Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent out a raven; it went to and fro until the waters were dried up from upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent out a dove to see whether the waters had subsided from upon the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the dove did not find a resting place for the sole of her foot, and she returned to him into the ark, for the waters were still on the face of the earth. And he stretched out his hand and took her, and brought her to himself into the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he waited another seven days, and again he sent out the dove from the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dove came to him in the evening, and behold, a freshly-picked olive tree leaf was in her mouth. And Noah knew that the waters had subsided from upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he waited seven more days, and he sent out the dove. But it did not return again to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that, in the six hundred and first year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the waters dried up from upon the earth. And Noah removed the covering of the ark and looked. And behold, the face of the ground was dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke to Noah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go out from the ark, you and your wife, and your sons, and your sons’ wives with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring out with you all the living things which are with you, from all the living creatures—birds, and animals, and everything that creeps on the earth, and let them swarm on the earth and be fruitful and multiply on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Noah went out, with his sons and his wife, and the wives of his sons with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, and everything that moves upon the earth, according to its families, went out from the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah built an altar to Yahweh, and he took from all the clean animals and from all the clean birds, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh smelled the soothing fragrance, and Yahweh said to himself, “Never again will I curse the ground for the sake of humankind, because the inclination of the heart of humankind is evil from his youth. Nor will I ever again destroy all life as I have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as the earth endures, seed and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night will not cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear of you and dread of you shall be upon every animal of the earth, and on every bird of heaven, and on everything that moves upon the ground, and on all the fish of the sea. Into your hand they shall be given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every moving thing that lives shall be for you as food. As I gave the green plants to you, I have now given you everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only you shall not eat raw flesh with blood in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your lifeblood I will require; from every animal I will require it. And from the hand of humankind, from the hand of each man to his brother I will require the life of humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As for the one shedding the blood of humankind,
    by humankind his blood shall be shed,
for God made humankind in his own image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, be fruitful and multiply, swarm on the earth and multiply in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Noah and to his sons with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, behold, I am establishing my covenant with you and with your seed after you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with every living creature that is with you—the birds, the animals, and every animal of the earth with you, from all that came out of the ark to all the animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am establishing my covenant with you, that never again will all flesh be cut off by the waters of a flood, nor will there ever be a flood that destroys the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “This is the sign of the covenant that I am making between me and you, and between every living creature that is with you for future generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bow I have set in the clouds, and it shall be for a sign of the covenant between me and between the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I make clouds appear over the earth the bow shall be seen in the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will remember my covenant that is between me and you, and between every living creature, with all flesh. And the waters of a flood will never again cause the destruction of all flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bow shall be in the clouds, and I will see it, so as to remember the everlasting covenant between God and between every living creature, with all flesh that is upon the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant which I am establishing between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. (Ham was the father of Canaan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah began to be a man of the ground, and he planted a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he drank some of the wine and became drunk, and he exposed himself in the midst of his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and he told his two brothers outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shem and Japheth took a garment, and the two of them put it on their shoulders and, walking backward, they covered the nakedness of their father. And their faces were turned backward, so that they did not see the nakedness of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Noah awoke from his drunkenness, and he knew what his youngest son had done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said,
“Cursed be Canaan,
    a slave of slaves he shall be to his brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he said,
“Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Shem,
    and let Canaan be a slave to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God make space for Japheth,
    and let him dwell in the tents of Shem,
    and let Canaan be a slave for him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah lived three hundred and fifty years after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of the sons of Noah—Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Children were born to them after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From these the coastland peoples spread out through their lands, each according to his own language by their own families, in their nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put, and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cush fathered Nimrod. He was the first on earth to be a mighty warrior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it was said, “Like Nimrod a mighty hunter before Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Akkad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that land he went out to Assyria, and he built Nineveh, Rehoboth-Ir, Calah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resen between Nineveh and Calah; that is the great city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Egypt fathered Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whom the Philistines came), and Caphtorim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canaan fathered Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the territory of the Canaanites was from Sidon in the direction of Gerar as far as Gaza, and in the direction of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the descendants of Ham, according to their families and their languages, in their lands, and in their nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the older brother of Japheth, children were also born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Arphaxad fathered Shelah, and Shelah fathered Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Eber two sons were born. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided, and the name of his brother was Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their dwelling place extended from Mesha in the direction of Sephar to the hill country of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shem, according to their families, according to their languages, in their lands, and according to their nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, according to their generations and in their nations. And from these the nations spread abroad on the earth after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the whole earth had one language and the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as people migrated from the east they found a plain in the land of Shinar and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to each other, “Come, let us make bricks and burn them thoroughly.” And they had brick for stone and they had tar for mortar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower whose top reaches to the heavens. And let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered over the face of the whole earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower that humankind was building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said, “Behold, they are one people with one language, and this is only the beginning of what they will do. So now nothing that they intend to do will be impossible for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us go down and confuse their language there, so that they will not understand each other’s language.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh scattered them from there over the face of the whole earth, and they stopped building the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore its name was called Babel, for there Yahweh confused the language of the whole earth, and there Yahweh scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Shem. When Shem was one hundred years old, he fathered Arphaxad, two years after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shem lived five hundred years after he fathered Arphaxad, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Arphaxad had lived thirty-five years, he fathered Shelah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Arphaxad lived four hundred and three years after he fathered Shelah, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shelah had lived thirty years, he fathered Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shelah lived four hundred and three years after he fathered Eber, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Eber had lived thirty-four years, he fathered Peleg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eber lived four hundred and thirty years after he fathered Peleg, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peleg had lived thirty years, he fathered Reu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peleg lived two hundred and nine years after he fathered Reu, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Reu had lived thirty-two years, he fathered Serug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Reu lived two hundred and seven years after he fathered Serug, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Serug had lived thirty years, he fathered Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Serug lived two hundred years after he fathered Nahor, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Nahor had lived twenty-nine years, he fathered Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nahor lived one hundred and nineteen years after he fathered Terah, and he fathered other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Terah had lived seventy years, he fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran fathered Lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Haran died in the presence of Terah his father in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves. The name of the wife of Abram was Sarai, and the name of the wife of Nahor was Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarai was barren; she had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot, the son of Haran, his grandson, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, the wife of Abram his son, and went out with them from Ur of the Chaldeans to go to the land of Canaan. And they went to Haran, and they settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years, and Terah died in Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Abram, “Go out from your land and from your relatives, and from the house of your father, to the land that I will show you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make you a great nation, and I will bless you, and I will make your name great. And you will be a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bless those who bless you, and those who curse you I will curse. And all families of the earth will be blessed in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram went out as Yahweh had told him, and Lot went with him. Now Abram was seventy-five years old when he went out from Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his nephew, and all their possessions that they had gathered, and all the persons that they had acquired in Haran, and they went out to go to the land of Canaan. And they went to the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram traveled through the land up to the place of Shechem, to the Oak of Moreh. Now the Canaanites were in the land at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh appeared to Abram and said, “To your offspring I will give this land.” And he built an altar there to Yahweh, who had appeared to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he moved on from there to the hill country, east of Bethel. And he pitched his tent at Bethel on the west, and at Ai on the east. And he built an altar there to Yahweh. And he called on the name of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram kept moving on, toward the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a famine in the land. And Abram went down to Egypt to dwell as an alien there, for the famine was severe in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as he drew near to enter into Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, “Look now, I know that you are a woman beautiful of appearance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall happen that, if the Egyptians see you, then they will say, ‘This is his wife,’ then they will kill me but let you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please say you are my sister so that it will go well for me on your account. Then I will live on account of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as Abram came into Egypt, the Egyptians saw the woman, that she was very beautiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the officials of Pharaoh saw her, and they praised her beauty to Pharaoh. And the woman was taken to the house of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he dealt well with Abram on account of her, and he had sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh afflicted Pharaoh and his household with severe plagues on account of the matter of Sarai the wife of Abram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me? Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you say ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to myself as a wife? Now then, here is your wife. Take her and go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him, and then sent him and his wife and all that was with him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram went up from Egypt, he and his wife and all that was with him. And Lot went with him to the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abram was very wealthy in livestock, in silver, and in gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went according to his journey from the Negev, then to Bethel, to the place where his tent was at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the place where he had made an altar at the beginning. And Abram called on the name of Yahweh there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot, who went with Abram, also had herds and tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the land could not support them so as to live together, because their possessions were so many that they were not able to live together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a quarrel between the herdsmen of the livestock of Abram and the herdsmen of the livestock of Lot. Now at that time the Canaanites and the Perizzites were living in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram said to Lot, “Please, let there not be quarreling between me and you, and between my shepherds and your shepherds, for we men are brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the whole land before you? Separate yourself from me. If you want what is on the left, then I will go right; if you want what is on the right, I will go left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot lifted up his eyes and saw the whole plain of the Jordan, that all of it was well-watered land—this was before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah—like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt in the direction of Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Lot chose for himself all the plain of the Jordan. And Lot journeyed from the east, and so they separated from each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram settled in the land of Canaan, and Lot settled in the cities of the plain. And he pitched his tent toward Sodom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men of Sodom were extremely wicked sinners against Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Abram after Lot had separated from him, “Now, lift up your eyes and look from the place where you are to the north, and to the south, and to the east and to the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all the land which you see I will give to you, and to your descendants, forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make your descendants like the dust of the earth which, if anyone were able to count the dust of the earth, your descendants would be so counted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, go through the length of the land and through its breadth, for I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram pitched his tent, and he came and settled at the oaks of Mamre, which were at Hebron. And there he built an altar to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that in the days of Amraphel, the king of Shinar, Arioch, the king of Ellasar, Kedorlaomer, the king of Elam, and Tidal, the king of Goiim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: made war with Bera, the king of Sodom, and Birsha, the king of Gomorrah, Shinab, the king of Admah, and Shemeber, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these joined forces at the valley of Siddim (that is, the sea of the salt).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve years they had served Kedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourteenth year Kedorlaomer and the kings who were with him came and defeated the Rephaim in Ashteroth-Karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh-Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Horites in their hill country of Seir, as far as El-Paran, which is at the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned back and came to En-Mishpat (that is, Kadesh). And they defeated the whole territory of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who were living in Hazazon-Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) went out, and they took up battle position in the Valley of Siddim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Kedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim, and Amraphel, king of Shinar, and Arioch, king of Ellasar, four kings against five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of tar pits. And the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled and fell into them, but the rest fled to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took all the possessions of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and they left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took Lot, the son of the brother of Abram, and his possessions, and left. (Now he had been living in Sodom.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one who escaped came and told Abram the Hebrew. And he was living at the oaks of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner. They were allies with Abram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he summoned his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen of them, and he went in pursuit up to Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he divided his trained men against them at night, he and his servants. And he defeated them and pursued them to Hobah, which is north of Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought back all the possessions. And he also brought back Lot, his relative, and his possessions, and the women and the people as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After his return from defeating Kedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the Valley of the King).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Melchizedek, the king of Salem, brought out bread and wine. (He was the priest of God Most High).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he blessed him and said,
“Blessed be Abram by God Most High,
    Maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And blessed be God Most High
    who delivered your enemies into your hand.”
And he gave to him a tenth of everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people, but the possessions take for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have raised my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that neither a thread nor a thong of a sandal would I take from all that belongs to you, that you might not say, ‘I made Abram rich.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing besides what the servants have eaten and the share of the men who went out with me will I take. Let Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre take their share.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things the word of Yahweh came to Abram in a vision, saying: “Do not be afraid, Abram; I am your shield, and your reward shall be very great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram said, “O Yahweh, my Lord, what will you give me? I continue to be childless, and my heir is Eliezer of Damascus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram said, “Look, you have not given me a descendant, and here, a member of my household is my heir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the word of Yahweh came to him saying, “This person will not be your heir, but your own son will be your heir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought him outside and said, “Look toward the heavens and count the stars if you are able to count them.” And he said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he believed in Yahweh, and he reckoned it to him as righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “I am Yahweh, who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to give this land to you, to possess it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “O Yahweh God, how shall I know that I will possess it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Take for me a three-year-old heifer, and a three-year-old female goat, and a three-year-old ram, and a turtledove and a young pigeon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took for him all these and cut them in pieces down the middle. And he put each piece opposite the other, but the birds he did not cut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the birds of prey came down on the carcasses, but Abram drove them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, as the sun went down, then a deep sleep fell upon Abram and, behold, a great terrifying darkness fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Abram, “You must surely know that your descendants shall be as aliens in a land not their own. And they shall serve them and they shall oppress them four hundred years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also the nation that they serve I will judge. Then afterward they shall go out with great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for you, you shall go to your ancestors in peace; you shall be buried in a good old age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fourth generation shall return here, for the guilt of the Amorites is not yet complete.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the sun had gone down and it was dusk, behold, a smoking firepot and a flaming torch passed between those half pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Yahweh made a covenant with Abram saying, “To your offspring I will give this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the Euphrates river,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land of the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarai, the wife of Abram, had borne him no children. And she had a female Egyptian servant, and her name was Hagar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarai said to Abram, “Look, please, Yahweh has prevented me from bearing children. Please go in to my servant; perhaps I will have children by her.” And Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Sarai, the wife of Abram, took Hagar, her Egyptian servant, after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to Abram her husband as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went in to Hagar, and she conceived. And when she saw that she had conceived, then her mistress grew small in her eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarai said to Abram, “may my harm be upon you. I had my servant sleep with you, and when she saw that she had conceived, she no longer respected me. May Yahweh judge between me and you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram said to Sarai, “Look, your servant is under your authority. Do to her that which is good in your eyes.” And Sarai mistreated her, and she fled from her presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of Yahweh found her at a spring of water in the wilderness, at the spring by the road of Shur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Hagar, the servant of Sarai, “From where have you come, and where are you going?” And she said, “I am fleeing from the presence of Sarai my mistress.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of Yahweh said to her, “Return to your mistress and submit yourself under her authority.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of Yahweh said to her, “I will greatly multiply your offspring, so that they cannot be counted for their abundance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the angel of Yahweh said to her:
“Behold, you are pregnant
    and shall have a son.
And you shall call his name Ishmael,
    for Yahweh has listened to your suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he shall be a wild donkey of a man,
    his hand will be against everyone,
    and the hand of everyone will be against him,
and he will live in hostility with all his brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she called the name of Yahweh who spoke to her, “You are El-Roi,” for she said, “Here I have seen after he who sees me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the well was called Beer-Lahai-Roi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hagar had a child for Abram, a son. And Abram called the name of his son whom Hagar bore to him, Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old Yahweh appeared to Abram. And he said to him, “I am El-Shaddai; walk before me and be blameless
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that I may make my covenant between me and you, and may multiply you exceedingly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram fell upon his face and God spoke with him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, behold, my covenant shall be with you, and you shall be the father of a multitude of nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your name shall no longer be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I will make you the father of a multitude of nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make you exceedingly fruitful. I will make you a nation, and kings shall go out from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will establish my covenant between me and you, and between your offspring after you, throughout their generations as an everlasting covenant to be as God for you and to your offspring after you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give to you and to your offspring after you the land in which you are living as an alien, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting property. And I will be to them as God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Abraham, “Now as for you, you must keep my covenant, you and your offspring after you, throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my covenant which you shall keep, between me and you, and also with your offspring after you: Every male among you shall be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at eight days of age you shall yourselves circumcise every male belonging to your generations and the servant born in your house and the one bought from any foreigner who is not from your offspring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must certainly circumcise the servant born in your house and the one bought from any foreigner. And my covenant shall be with your flesh as an everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for any uncircumcised male who has not circumcised the flesh of his foreskin, that person shall be cut off from his people. He has broken my covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Abraham, “as for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, for Sarah shall be her name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bless her; moreover, I give to you from her a son. And I will bless her, and she shall give rise to nations. Kings of peoples shall come from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham fell upon his face and laughed. And he said in his heart, “Can a child be born to a man a hundred years old, or can Sarah bear a child at ninety?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said to God, “Oh that Ishmael might live before you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “No, but Sarah your wife shall bear a son for you, and you shall call his name Isaac. And I will establish my covenant with him as an everlasting covenant to his offspring after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for Ishmael, I have heard you. Behold, I will bless him and I will make him fruitful, and I will multiply him exceedingly. He shall father twelve princes, and I will make him a great nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this appointed time next year.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he finished speaking with him, God went up from Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham took Ishmael his son and all who were born of his house, and all those acquired by his money, every male among the men of Abraham’s house, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskin on the same day that God spoke with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the men of his house, those born in the house, and those acquired by money from a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre. And he was sitting in the doorway of the tent at the heat of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lifted up his eyes and saw, and behold, three men were standing near him. And he saw them and ran from the doorway of the tent to meet them. And he bowed down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “My lord, if I have found favor in your eyes do not pass by your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a little water be brought and wash your feet, and rest under the tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let me bring a piece of bread, then refresh yourselves. Afterward you can pass on, once you have passed by with your servant.” Then they said, “Do so as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and he said, “Quickly—make three seahs of fine flour for kneading and make bread cakes!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham ran to the cattle and took a calf, tender and good, and gave it to the servant, and he made haste to prepare it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took curds and milk, and the calf which he prepared, and set it before them. And he was standing by them under the tree while they ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Where is Sarah your wife?” And he said, “Here, in the tent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I will certainly return to you in the spring, and look, Sarah your wife will have a son.” Now Sarah was listening at the doorway of the tent, and which was behind him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in age; the way of women had ceased to be for Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Sarah laughed to herself saying, “After I am worn out and my husband is old, shall this pleasure be to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Abraham, “What is this that Sarah laughed, saying, ‘Is it indeed true that I will bear a child, now that I have grown old?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is anything too difficult for Yahweh? At the appointed time I will return to you in the spring and Sarah shall have a son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sarah denied it, saying, “I did not laugh,” because she was afraid. He said, “No, but you did laugh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men set out from there, and they looked down upon Sodom. And Abraham went with them to send them on their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said, “Shall I conceal from Abraham what I am going to do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham will surely become a great and strong nation, and all the nations of the earth will be blessed on account of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have chosen him, that he will command his children and his household after him that they will keep the way of Yahweh, to do righteousness and justice, so that Yahweh may bring upon Abraham that which he said to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said, “Because the outcry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great and because their sin is very serious,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go down and I will see. Have they done altogether according to its cry of distress which has come to me? If not, I will know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men turned from there and went toward Sodom. And Abraham was still standing before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham drew near to Yahweh and said, “Will you also sweep away the righteous with the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If perhaps there are fifty righteous in the midst of the city, will you also sweep them away and not forgive the place on account of the fifty righteous in her midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Far be it from you to do such a thing as this, to kill the righteous with the wicked, that the righteous would be as the wicked! Far be it from you! Will not the Judge of all the earth do justice?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said, “If I find fifty righteous in Sodom, in the midst of the city, then I will forgive the whole place for their sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham answered and said, “Look, please, I was bold to speak to my Lord, but I am dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps the fifty righteous are lacking five—will you destroy the whole city on account of the five?” And he answered, “I will not destroy it if I find forty-five there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And once again he spoke to him and said, “What if forty are found there?” And he answered, “I will not do it on account of the forty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Please, let not my Lord be angry, and I will speak. What if thirty be found there?” And he answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Please, now, I was bold to speak to my Lord. What if twenty be found there?” And he answered, “I will not destroy it for the sake of the twenty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Please, let not my Lord be angry, and I will speak only once more. What if ten are found there?” And he answered, “I will not destroy it for the sake of the ten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh left, as he finished speaking to Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the two angels came to Sodom in the evening. And Lot was sitting in the gateway of Sodom. Then Lot saw them and stood up to meet them. And he bowed down with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Behold, my lords, please turn aside into the house of your servant and spend the night and wash your feet. Then you can rise early and go on your way.” And they said, “No, but we will spend the night in the square.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he urged them strongly, and they turned aside with him and came into his house. And he made a meal for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before they laid down, the men of the city, the men of Sodom, both young and old, all the people to the last man, surrounded the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us so that we may know them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Lot went out to them at the entrance, and he shut the door behind him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “No, my brothers, please do not do such a wrong thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have two daughters who have not known a man. Please, let me bring them out to you; then do to them as it seems good in your eyes. Only to these men do not do this thing, since they came under my roof for protection.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Step aside!” Then they said, “This fellow came to dwell as a foreigner and he acts as a judge! Now we shall do worse to you than them!” And they pressed very hard against the man, against Lot, and they drew near to break the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men reached out with their hands and brought Lot in to them, into the house, and they shut the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who were at the entrance of the house they struck with blindness, both small and great, and they were unable to find the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men said to Lot, “Who is here with you? Bring out from the place your sons-in-law, and your sons and your daughters, and all who are with you in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are about to destroy this place, because their cry has become great before Yahweh. Yahweh sent us to destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law who were taking his daughters and said, “Get up! Go out from this place, because Yahweh is going to destroy the city!” But it seemed like a joke in the eyes of his sons-in-law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the dawn came up the angels urged Lot saying, “Get up, take your wife and your two daughters who are staying with you, lest you be destroyed with the punishment of the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he lingered, the men seized him by his hand and his wife’s hand, and his two daughters by hand, on account of the mercy of Yahweh upon him. And they brought him out and set him outside of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after bringing them outside one said, “Flee for your life; do not look behind you, and do not stand anywhere in the plain. Flee to the mountains lest you be destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot said to them, “No, please, my lords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your servant has found favor in your eyes and you have shown me great kindness in saving my life. But I cannot flee to the mountains, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, this city is near enough to flee there, and it is a little one. Please, let me flee there. Is it not a little one? Then my life shall be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Behold, I will grant this favor as well; that I will not overthrow the city of which you have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Escape there quickly, for I cannot do this thing until you get there.” Therefore, there name of the city was called Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the sun had risen upon the earth and Lot had entered Zoar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh rained down from heaven upon Sodom and Gomorrah brimstone and fire from Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overthrew those cities and the whole plain, and the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his wife looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham arose early in the morning and went to the place where he had stood before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked down upon the surface of Sodom and Gomorrah, and upon the whole surface of the land, the plain. And he saw that, behold, the smoke of the land went up like the smoke of a smelting furnace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was, when God destroyed the cities of the plain that God remembered Abraham and sent Lot out from the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in which Lot lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot went out from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to stay in Zoar. So he lived in a cave, he and his two daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the firstborn daughter said to the younger one, “Our father is old, and there is no man in the land to come in to us according to the manner of all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us give our father wine to drink and let us lie with him that we may secure descendants through our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave their father wine to drink that night, and the firstborn went and lay with her father, but he did not know when she lay down or when she got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that, the next day the firstborn said to the younger one, “Look, I laid with my father last night. Let us give him wine to drink also tonight, then go and lie with him that we may secure descendants through our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
