verses.text: And they gave their father wine to drink again that night, and the younger got up and lay with him, but he did not know when she lay down or when she got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the two daughters of Lot became pregnant by their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstborn gave birth to a son, and she called his name Moab. He is the father of Moab until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the younger, she also gave birth to a son, and she called his name Ben-Ammi. He is the father of the Ammonites until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham journeyed from there to the land of the Negev, and he settled between Kadesh and Shur. And he dwelled as an alien in Gerar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said about Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” And Abimelech king of Gerar sent and took Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Abimelech in a dream at night. And he said to him, “Look, you are a dead man on account of the woman you have taken. For she is a married woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abimelech had not approached her, so he said, “my Lord, will you even kill a righteous people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not he himself say to me, ‘She is my sister’? And she herself said, ‘He is my brother.’ With integrity of my heart and with cleanness of my hands I did this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to him in the dream, “Yes, I know that in the integrity of your heart you did this, and I also kept you from sinning against me. Therefore, I did not allow you to touch her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, return the wife of the man, for he is a prophet, so that he will pray for you and you will live. And if you do not return her, know that you will certainly die, and all that are yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech rose early in the morning. And he called all his servants and told them all these things, and the men were very afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech called for Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? And how have I sinned against you that you brought upon me and upon my kingdom a great sin? You have done things to me that should not be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Abraham, “What were you thinking that you did this thing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said, “Because I thought, surely there is no fear of God in this place; they will kill me on account of the matter of my wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, she is my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother. And she became my wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as God caused me to wander from the house of my father I said to her, ‘This is your loyal kindness that you must do for me at every place where we come: say concerning me, “He is my brother.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech took sheep and cattle and male slaves and female slaves, and he gave them to Abraham. And he returned Sarah his wife to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said, “Here is my land before you; settle where it pleases you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Sarah he said, “Look, I have given a thousand pieces of silver to your brother. It shall be an exoneration. You are vindicated before all who are with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his female servants so that they could bear children again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh had completely closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech because of the matter of Sarah, the wife of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh visited Sarah as he had said. And Yahweh did to Sarah as he had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived, and Sarah bore to Abraham a son in his old age at the appointed time that God had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham called the name of his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham circumcised Isaac his son when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham was one hundred years old when Isaac his son was born to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah said, “God has made laughter for me; all who hear will laugh for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Who would announce to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have borne a son to Abraham in his old age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew and was weaned. And Abraham made a great feast on the day Isaac was weaned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne Abraham, mocking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said to Abraham, “Drive out this slave woman and her son, for the son of this slave woman will not be heir with my son, with Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the matter displeased Abraham very much on account of his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Abraham, “Do not be displeased on account of the boy and on account of the slave woman. Listen to everything that Sarah said to you, for through Isaac your offspring will be named.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will also make the son of the slave woman into a nation, for he is your offspring.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham rose up early in the morning and took bread and a skin of water and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder. And he sent her away with the child, and she went, wandering about in the wilderness, in Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the water was finished from the skin, she put the child under one of the bushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she went and she sat a good distance away, for she said, “Let me not see the child’s death.” So she sat away from him and lifted up her voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God heard the cry of the boy and the angel of God called to Hagar from the heavens and said to her, “What is the matter Hagar? Do not be afraid, for God has heard the cry of the boy from where he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, take up the boy and take him with your hand, for I will make him a great nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. And she went and filled the skin with water and gave a drink to the boy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God was with the boy, and he grew and lived in the wilderness. And he became an expert with a bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lived in the wilderness of Paran. And his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that at that time, Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, said to Abraham, “God is with you, in all that you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, swear to me here by God that you will not deal with me falsely, or with my descendants, or my posterity. According to the kindness that I have done to you, you shall pledge to do with me and with the land where you have dwelled as an alien.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said, “I swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham complained to Abimelech on account of the well of water that servants of Abimelech had seized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this thing, neither did you tell me, nor have I heard of it except for today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham took sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech. And the two of them made a covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham set off seven ewe-lambs of the flock by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Abraham, “What is the meaning of these seven ewe-lambs that you have set off by themselves?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “You shall take the seven ewe-lambs from my hand as proof on my behalf that I dug this well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that place is called Beersheba, because there the two of them swore an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made a covenant at Beersheba. And Abimelech, and Phicol his army commander stood and returned to the land of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and there he called on the name of Yahweh, the everlasting God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham dwelled as an alien in the land of the Philistines many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after these things, God tested Abraham. And he said to him, “Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Take your son, your only child, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains where I will tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning and saddled his donkey. And he took two of his servants with him, and Isaac his son. And he chopped wood for a burnt offering. And he got up and went to the place which God had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and he saw the place at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said to his servants, “You stay here with the donkey, and I and the boy will go up there. We will worship, then we will return to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and placed it on Isaac his son. And he took the fire in his hand and the knife, and the two of them went together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac said to Abraham his father, “My father!” And he said, “Here I am, my son.” And he said, “Here is the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said, “God will provide the lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them went together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to the place that God had told him. And Abraham built an altar there and arranged the wood. Then he bound Isaac his son and placed him on the altar atop the wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of Yahweh called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham! Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Do not stretch out your hand against the boy; do not do anything to him. For now I know that you are one who fears God, since you have not withheld your son, your only child, from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham lifted up his eyes and looked. And behold, a ram was caught in the thicket by his horns. And Abraham went and took the ram, and offered it as a burnt offering in place of his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham called the name of that place “Yahweh will provide,” for which reason it is said today, “on the mountain of Yahweh it shall be provided.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of Yahweh called to Abraham a second time from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I swear by myself, declares Yahweh, that because you have done this thing and have not withheld your son, your only child,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I will certainly bless you and greatly multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven, and as the sand that is by the shore of the sea. And your offspring will take possession of the gate of his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations of the earth will be blessed through your offspring, because you have listened to my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham returned to his servants, and they got up and went together to Beersheba. And Abraham lived in Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after these things, it was told to Abraham, “Look, Milcah has also borne children to your brother Nahor:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uz his firstborn and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Kesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now, Bethuel fathered Rebekah). These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, the brother of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah lived one hundred and twenty-seven years; these were the years of the life of Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah died in Kiriath Arba; that is Hebron, in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham went to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her. And Abraham rose up from his dead, and he spoke to the Hittites and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am a stranger and an alien among you; give to me my own burial site among you so that I may bury my dead from before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Hittites answered Abraham and said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear us, my lord, you are a mighty prince in our midst. Bury your dead in the choicest of our burial sites. None of us will withhold his burial site from you for burying your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham rose up and bowed to the people of the land, to the Hittites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke with them, saying, “If you are willing that I bury my dead from before me, hear me and intercede for me with Ephron the son of Zohar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he may sell to me the cave of Machpelah which belongs to him, which is at the end of his field. At full value let him sell it to me in your midst as a burial site.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ephron was sitting among the Hittites. And Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites with respect to all who were entering the gate of his city, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No, my lord, hear me. I give you the field and the cave which is in it, I also give it to you in the sight of the children of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham bowed before the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If only you will hear me—I give the price of the field. Take it from me that I may bury my dead there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My lord, hear me. A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver—what is that between me and you? Bury your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed for Ephron the silver that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites: four hundred shekels of silver at the merchants’ current rate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the field of Ephron which was in the Machpelah, which was near Mamre—the field and the cave which was in it, with all the trees that were in the field, which were within all its surrounding boundaries—passed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Abraham as a property in the presence of the Hittites, with respect to all who were entering the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus afterward Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah near Mamre; that is Hebron, in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the field and the cave which was in it passed to Abraham as a burial site from the Hittites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham was old, advanced in age, and Yahweh had blessed Abraham in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his house, who had charge of all he had, “Please put your hand under my thigh
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make you swear by Yahweh, the God of heaven and the God of earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose midst I am dwelling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but that you will go to my land and to my family, and take a wife for my son, for Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant said to him, “Perhaps the woman will not be willing to follow me to this land—must I then return your son to the land from whence you came?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said to him, “You must take care that you do not return my son there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh, the God of heaven who took me from the house of my father and from the land of my family, and who spoke to me and swore to me, saying, ‘to your offspring I will give this land,’ he will send his angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the woman is not willing to follow you, then you shall be released from this oath of mine—only you must not return my son there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and he swore to him concerning this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant took ten camels from his master’s camels, and he went with all kinds of his master’s good things in his hand. And he arose and went to Aram-Naharaim, to the city of Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the camels kneel outside the city at the well of water, at the time of evening, toward the time the women went out to draw water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “O Yahweh, God of my master Abraham, please grant me success today and show loyal love to my master Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water, and the daughters of the men of the city are going out to draw water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let it be that the girl to whom I shall say, ‘Please, offer your jar that I may drink’ and who says, ‘Drink—and I will also water your camels,’ she is the one you have chosen for your servant, for Isaac. By her I will know that you have shown loyal love to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that before he had finished speaking, behold, Rebekah—who was born to Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, the brother of Abraham—came out, and her jar was on her shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the girl was very pleasing in appearance. She was a virgin; no man had known her. And she went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant ran to meet her. And he said, “Please, let me drink a little of the water from your jar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Drink, my lord.” And she quickly lowered her jar in her hand and gave him a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she finished giving him a drink she said, “I will also draw water for your camels until they finish drinking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she quickly emptied her jar into the trough and ran again to the well to draw water. And she drew water for all his camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man was gazing at her silently to know if Yahweh had made his journey successful or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as the camels finished drinking the man took a gold ring of a half shekel in weight and two bracelets for her arms, ten shekels in weight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Please tell me, whose daughter are you? Is there a place at the house of your father for us to spend the night?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said to him, “We have both straw and fodder in abundance, as well as a place to spend the night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man knelt down and worshiped Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Blessed be Yahweh, God of my master Abraham, who has not withheld his loyal love and his faithfulness from my master. I was on the way and Yahweh led me to the house of my master’s brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the girl ran and reported these things to the household of her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban. And Laban ran out to the man toward the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw the ring and the bracelets on the arms of his sister and heard the words of Rebekah his sister, who said, “Thus the man spoke to me,” he went to the man. And behold, he was standing with the camels at the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Come, O blessed one of Yahweh. Why do you stand outside? Now I have prepared the house and a place for the camels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man came to the house and unloaded the camels. And he gave straw and fodder to the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And food was placed before him to eat. And he said, “I will not eat until I have told my errand.” And he said, “Speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I am the servant of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Yahweh has blessed my master exceedingly, and he has become great. He has given to him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male slaves and female slaves, and camels and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah, the wife of my master, has borne a son to my master after her old age. And he has given to him all that he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my master made me swear, saying, ‘Do not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I am living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall go to the house of my father, and to my family, and you shall take a wife for my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said to my master, ‘Perhaps the woman will not follow me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, ‘Yahweh, before whom I have walked, shall send his angel with you and will make your journey successful. And you shall take a wife for my son from my family, and from the house of my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall be released from my oath, when you come to my family. And if they will not give a woman to you, then you will be released from my oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then today I came to the spring, and I said, ‘O Yahweh, God of my master Abraham, if you would please make my journey successful, upon which I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water. Let it be that the young woman who comes out to draw water and to whom I say, “Please give me a little water to drink from your jar,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let her say to me, “Drink; I will also draw water for your camels,” she is the woman whom Yahweh has appointed for the son of my master.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I had not yet finished speaking to myself when, behold, Rebekah was coming out with her jar on her shoulder. And she went down to the spring and drew water. And I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she hastened and let down her jar from her shoulder and said, ‘Drink, and I will give a drink to your camels also.’ Then I drank and she gave a drink to the camels also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I asked her and said, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And I put the ring on her nose and the bracelets on her arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I knelt down and worshiped Yahweh, and I praised Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, who led me on the right way, to take the daughter of the brother of my master for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, if you are going to deal loyally and truly with my master, tell me. And if not, tell me, so that I may turn to the right or to the left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, and they said, “The matter has gone out from Yahweh; we are not able to speak bad or good to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is Rebekah before you. Take her and go; let her be a wife for the son of your master as Yahweh has spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when the servant of Abraham heard their words he bowed down to the ground to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant brought out silver jewelry and gold jewelry, and garments, and he gave them to Rebekah. And he gave precious gifts to her brother and to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he and the men who were with him ate and drank, and they spent the night. And they got up in the morning, and he said, “Let me go to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her brother and her mother said, “Let the girl remain with us ten days or so; after that she may go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Do not delay me. Now, Yahweh has made my journey successful. Let me go. I must go to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Let us call the girl and ask her opinion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and the servant of Abraham and his men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they blessed Rebekah and said to her, “You are our sister; may you become countless thousands; and may your offspring take possession of the gate of his enemies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rebekah and her maidservants arose, and they mounted the camels and followed the man. And the servant took Rebekah and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Isaac was coming from the direction of Beer-Lahai-Roi. And he was living in the land of the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field early in the evening, and he lifted up his eyes and saw—behold, camels were coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes and saw Isaac. And she got down from the camel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to the servant, “Who is this man walking around in the field to meet us?” And the servant said, “That is my master.” And she took her veil and covered herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac brought her to the tent of Sarah his mother. And he took Rebekah, and she became his wife. And Isaac loved her and was comforted after the death of his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham again took a wife, and her name was Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she bore to him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jokshan fathered Sheba and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim and Letushim and Leummim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abidah, and Eldaah. All of these were the children of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham gave all he had to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the sons of Abraham’s concubines Abraham gave gifts. And while he was still living he sent them away eastward, away from his son Isaac, to the land of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the days of the years of the life of Abraham: one hundred and seventy-five years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham passed away and died in a good old age, old and full of years. And he was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, son of Zohar the Hittite, that was east of Mamre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites. There Abraham was buried and Sarah his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after the death of Abraham God blessed Isaac his son, and Isaac settled at Beer-Lahai-Roi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, the son of Abraham, that Hagar the Egyptian, the maidservant of Sarah, bore to Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names according to their family records. The firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments—12 leaders according to their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the years of the life of Ishmael: 137 years. And he passed away and died, and was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They settled from Havilah to Shur, which was opposite Egypt, going toward Asshur, opposite; he settled opposite all his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the generations of Isaac, the son of Abraham. Abraham fathered Isaac,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-Aram, the sister of Laban the Aramean, as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac prayed to Yahweh on behalf of his wife, for she was barren. And Yahweh responded to his prayer, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children in her womb jostled each other, and she said, “If it is going to be like this, why be pregnant?” And she went to inquire of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to her, “Two nations are in your womb, and two peoples from birth shall be divided. And one people shall be stronger than the other. And the elder shall serve the younger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when her days to give birth were completed, then—behold—twins were in her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first came out red, all his body was like a hairy coat, so they called his name Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward his brother came out, and his hand grasped the heel of Esau, so his name was called Jacob. And Isaac was sixty years old at their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the boys grew up. And Esau was a skilled hunter, a man of the field, but Jacob was a peaceful man, living in tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac loved Esau because he could eat of his game, but Rebekah loved Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once Jacob cooked a thick stew, and Esau came in from the field, and he was exhausted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am exhausted!” (Therefore his name was called Edom).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said, “Sell me your birthright first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Esau said, “Look, I am going to die; now what is this birthright to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” And he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob gave Esau bread, and thick lentil stew, and he ate and drank. Then he got up and went away. So Esau despised his birthright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a famine in the land, besides the former famine which was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, to Gerar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; dwell in the land which I will show to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dwell as an alien in this land, and I will be with you, and will bless you, for I will give all these lands to you and to your descendants, and I will establish the oath that I swore to Abraham you father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will multiply your descendants like the stars of heaven, and I will give to your descendants all these lands. And all nations of the earth will be blessed through your offspring,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Abraham listened to my voice and kept my charge: my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Isaac settled in Gerar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men of the place asked concerning his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “my wife,” thinking “the men of the place will kill me on account of Rebekah, for she was beautiful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that, when he had been there a long time, Abimelech the king of the Philistines looked through the window, and saw—behold—Isaac was fondling Rebekah his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech called Isaac and said, “Surely she is your wife. Now why did you say ‘She is my sister’?” And Isaac said to him, “Because I thought I would die on account of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said, “What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have slept with your wife! Then you would have brought guilt upon us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech instructed all the people, saying, “The one who touches this man or his wife shall certainly die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac sowed in that land and reaped in that same year a hundredfold, and Yahweh blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man became wealthier and wealthier until he was exceedingly wealthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he possessed sheep and cattle and many servants, so that the Philistines envied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Philistines stopped up all the wells that the servants of his father had dug in the days of Abraham his father. They filled them with earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you have become much too powerful for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Isaac departed from there and camped in the valley of Gerar, and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac dug again the wells of water which they had dug in the days of his father Abraham, which the Philistines had stopped up after the death of Abraham. And he gave to them the same names which his father had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the servants of Isaac dug in the valley, they found a well of fresh water there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with the herdsmen of Isaac, saying, “The water is ours.” And he called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they dug another well, and they quarreled over it also. And he called its name Sitnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he moved from there and dug another well, and they did not quarrel over it. And he called its name Rehoboth, and said, “Now Yahweh has made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there he went up to Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh appeared to him that night and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham. Do not be afraid, for I am with you, and I will bless you and make your descendants numerous for the sake of my servant Abraham.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he built an altar there and called on the name of Yahweh. And he pitched his tent there, and the servants of Isaac dug a well there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar with Ahuzzath his friend and Phicol his army commander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me? You hate me and sent me away from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “We see clearly that Yahweh has been with you, so we thought let there be an oath between us—between us and you—and let us make a covenant with you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may not do us harm just as we have not touched you, but have only done good to you and sent you away in peace. You are now blessed by Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made a meal for them, and they ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they arose early in the morning and each one swore to the other, and Isaac sent them away. And they left him in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on that same day the servants of Isaac came and told him about the well that they had dug. And they said, “We have found water!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called it Sheba. Therefore the name of the city is Beersheba unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Esau was forty years old he took as wife Judith, daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, daughter of Elon the Hittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made life bitter for Isaac and Rebekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when Isaac was old and his eyesight was weak, he called Esau his older son and said to him, “My son.” And he said to him, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Look, I am old; I do not know the day of my death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field and hunt food for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then make for me tasty food like I love, and bring it to me. And I will eat it so that I can bless you before I die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rebekah was listening as Isaac spoke to Esau his son, and when Esau went to the field to hunt wild game to bring back,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah said to Jacob her son, “Look, I heard your father speaking to Esau your brother saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Bring wild game to me and prepare tasty food so I can eat it and bless you before Yahweh before my death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, my son, listen to my voice, to what I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the flock and take two good young goats from it for me, and I will prepare them as tasty food for your father, just as he likes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must take it to your father and he will eat it so that he may bless you before his death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to his mother, “Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, but I am a smooth man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps my father will feel me and I will be in his eyes as a mocker, and he will bring upon me a curse and not a blessing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his mother said to him, “Your curse be upon me, my son, only listen to my voice—go and get them for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and took them, and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared tasty food as his father liked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah took some of her older son Esau’s best garments that were with her in the house, and she put them on Jacob her younger son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she put the skins of the young goats over his hands and over the smooth part of his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she put the tasty food and the bread that she had made into the hand of Jacob, her son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went to his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am. Who are you, my son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your firstborn. I have done as you told me. Please get up, sit up and eat from my wild game so that you may bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac said to his son, “How did you find it so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because Yahweh your God caused me to find it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac said to Jacob, “Please, come near and let me feel you, my son. Are you really my son Esau or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob drew near to Isaac his father. And he felt him and said, “The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not recognize him because his hands were hairy like the hands of Esau his brother. And he blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Are you really my son Esau?” And he said, “I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Bring it near to me that I may eat from the game of my son, so that I may bless you.” And he brought it to him, and he ate. And he brought wine to him, and he drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come near and kiss me, my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he drew near and kissed him. And he smelled the smell of his garments, and he blessed him and said,
“Look, the smell of my son is like the smell of a field that Yahweh has blessed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God give you of the dew of heaven
    and of the fatness of the earth,
    and abundance of grain and new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let peoples serve you,
    and nations bow down to you;
Be lord of your brothers,
    and may the sons of your mother bow down to you.
Cursed be those cursing you,
    and blessed be those blessing you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as Isaac had finished blessing Jacob, immediately after Jacob had gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, Esau his brother came back from his hunting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He too prepared tasty food and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father arise and eat from the wild game of his son, that you may bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac his father said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac trembled violently. Then he said, “Who then was he that hunted wild game and brought it to me, and I ate it all before you came, and I blessed him? Moreover, he will be blessed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Esau heard the words of his father he cried out with a great and exceedingly bitter cry of distress. And he said to his father, “Bless me as well, my father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Your brother came in deceit and took your blessing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Isn’t that why he is named Jacob? He has deceived me these two times. He took my birthright and, look, now he has taken my blessing!” Then he said, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac answered and said to Esau, “Behold, I have made him lord over you and I have given him all his brothers as servants, and with grain and wine I have sustained him. Now what can I do for you, my son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Esau said to his father, “Have you only one blessing, my father? Bless me also, my father!” And Esau lifted up his voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Isaac his father answered and said to him,
“Your home shall be from the fatness of the land,
    and from the dew of heaven above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But by your sword you shall live,
    and you shall serve your brother.
But it shall be that when free yourself
    you shall tear off his yoke from your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau held a grudge against Jacob on account of the blessing with which his father had blessed him. And Esau said in his heart, “The days of mourning for my father are coming, then I will kill Jacob my brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah. And she sent and called for her younger son Jacob. And she said to him, “Look, Esau your brother is consoling himself concerning you, intending to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, my son, listen to my voice; arise and flee to Haran to Laban my brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay with him a few days until the wrath of your brother has turned—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the anger of your brother turns from you and he has forgotten what you have done to him. Then I will send and bring you from there. Why should I lose the two of you in one day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, “I loathe my life because of the Hittite women. If Jacob takes a wife from Hittite women like these, from the native women, what am I living for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac called Jacob and blessed him. And he instructed him and said to him, “You must not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, go to Paddan-Aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take for yourself a wife from there, from the daughters of Laban your mother’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, may El-Shaddai bless you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, so that you become an assembly of peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And may he give you the blessing of Abraham, to you and to your descendants with you, that you may take possession of the land of your sojourning, which God gave to Abraham.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac sent Jacob away, and he went to Paddan-Aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan-Aram, to take for himself a wife from there, and he blessed him and instructed him, saying, “You must not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that Jacob listened to his father and to his mother and went to Paddan-Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan were evil in the eyes of Isaac his father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Esau went to Ishmael and took Mahalath, the daughter of Ishmael, son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth, as a wife, in addition to the wives he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob went out from Beersheba and went to Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arrived at a certain place and spent the night there, because the sun had set. And he took one of the stones of the place and put it under his head and slept at that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he dreamed, and behold, a stairway was set on the earth, and its top touched the heavens. And behold, angels of God were going up and going down on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Yahweh was standing beside him, and he said, “I am Yahweh, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The ground on which you were sleeping I will give to you and to your descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your descendants shall be like the dust of the earth, and you will spread out to the west, and to the east, and to the north and to the south. And all the families of the earth will be blessed through you and through your descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, I am with you, and I will keep you wherever you go. And I will bring you to this land, for I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely Yahweh is indeed in this place and I did not know!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place! This is nothing else than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob rose early in the morning, and he took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a stone pillar, and poured oil on top of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of that place Bethel; however, the name of the city was formerly Luz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob made a vow saying, “If God will be with me and protect me on this way that I am going, and gives me food to eat and clothing to wear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I return in peace to the house of my father, then Yahweh will become my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this stone that I have set up as a pillar shall be the house of God, and of all that you give to me I will certainly give a tenth to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob continued his journey and went to the land of the Easterners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked, and behold, there was a well in the field, and behold, there were three flocks of sheep lying beside it, for out of that well the flocks were watered. And the stone on the mouth of the well was large.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the flocks were gathered there, they rolled away the stone from the mouth of the well. And they watered the sheep and returned the stone upon the mouth of the well to its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to them, “My brothers, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Do you know Laban, son of Nahor?” And they said, “We know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Is he well?” And they said, “He is well. Now look, Rachel his daughter is coming with the sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Look, it is still broad daylight; it is not the time for the livestock to be gathered. Give water to the sheep and go, pasture them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “We are not able, until all the flocks are gathered. Then the stone is rolled away from the mouth of the well, and we water the sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was speaking with them, Rachel came with the sheep which belonged to her father, for she was pasturing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that, when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of Laban, his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother’s brother, Jacob drew near and rolled away the stone from the mouth of the well and watered the sheep of Laban, his mother’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob told Rachel that he was the relative of her father, and that he was the son of Rebekah. And she ran and told her father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when Laban heard the message about Jacob, the son of his sister, he ran to meet him. And he embraced him and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban said to him, “Surely you are my flesh and my bone!” And he stayed with him a month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are my brother should you work for me for nothing? Tell me what your wage should be.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Laban had two daughters. The name of the older was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the eyes of Leah were dull, but Rachel was beautiful in form and appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob loved Rachel and said, “I will serve you seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said, “Better that I give her to you than I give her to another man. Stay with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob worked for Rachel seven years, but they were as a few days in his eyes because he loved her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, that I may go in to her, for my time is completed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Laban gathered all the men of the place and prepared a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that in the evening he took Leah his daughter and brought her to him, and he went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban gave Zilpah his female servant to her, to Leah his daughter as a female servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that in the morning, behold, it was Leah! And he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? Did I not serve with you for Rachel? Now why did you deceive me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said, “It is not the custom in our country to give the younger before the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Complete the week of this one, then I will also give you the other, on the condition that you will work for me another seven years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob did so. So he completed the week of this one, then he gave Rachel his daughter to him as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban gave Bilhah his female servant to Rachel his daughter as a female servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he also went in to Rachel, and he loved Rachel more than Leah. And he served with him yet another seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh saw that Leah was unloved he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah conceived and gave birth to a son, and she called his name Reuben, for she said, “Because Yahweh has noticed my misery, that I am unloved. Now my husband will love me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again and gave birth to a son. And she said, “It is because Yahweh has heard that I am unloved that he gave me this son also.” And she called his name Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again and gave birth to a son. Then she said, “Now this time my husband will be joined to me, for I have borne him three sons.” Therefore, she called his name Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again and gave birth to a son. And she said, “This time I will praise Yahweh.” Therefore she called his name Judah. And she ceased bearing children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Rachel saw that she could not bear children to Jacob, Rachel envied her sister. And she said to Jacob, “Give me children—if not, I will die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob became angry with Rachel. And he said, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said, “Here is my servant girl Bilhah; go in to her that she may bear children as my surrogate. Then I will even have children by her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she gave him Bilhah, her female servant, as a wife, and Jacob went in to her
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bilhah conceived and gave birth to a son for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rachel said, “God has judged me, and has also heard my voice, and has given me a son.” Therefore she called his name Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bilhah, Rachel’s servant, conceived again and bore a second son to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rachel said, “I have struggled a mighty struggle with my sister and have prevailed.” And she called his name Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Leah saw that she had ceased bearing children, she took Zilpah her female servant and gave her to Jacob as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zilpah, the female slave of Leah, bore a son to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “Good fortune!” And she called his name Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zilpah, Leah’s female servant, bore a second son to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “How happy am I! For women have called me happy.” So she called his name Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the days of the wheat harvest, Reuben went and found mandrakes in the field and he brought them to Leah his mother. And Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to her, “Is your taking my husband such a small thing that you will also take the mandrakes of my son?” Then Rachel said, “Then he may sleep with you tonight in exchange for your son’s mandrakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob came in from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him. And she said, “Come in to me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” And he slept with her that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God listened to Leah and she conceived and gave birth to a fifth son for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “God has given me my wage since I gave my servant girl to my husband.” And she called his name Issachar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah conceived again and gave birth to a sixth son for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah said, “God has endowed me with a good gift. This time my husband will acknowledge me, because I bore him six sons.” And she called his name Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward she gave birth to a daughter. And she called her name Dinah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God remembered Rachel and listened to her, and God opened her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived and gave birth to a son. And she said, “God has taken away my disgrace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she called his name Joseph, saying, “Yahweh has added to me another son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as soon as Rachel had given birth to Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away that I may go to my place and my land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give me my wives and my children for which I have served you, and let me go. For you yourself know my service that I have rendered to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Laban said to him, “Please, if I have found favor in your eyes, I have learned by divination that Yahweh has blessed me because of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Name your wage to me and I will give it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “You yourself know how I have served you and how your livestock have been with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you had little before me, and it has increased abundantly. And Yahweh has blessed you wherever I turned. So then, when shall I provide for my own family also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “What shall I give you?” And Jacob said, “Do not give me anything. If you will do this thing for me, I will again feed your flocks and keep them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me pass through all your flocks today, removing all the speckled and spotted sheep from them, along with every dark-colored sheep among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats. That shall be my wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my righteousness will answer for me later when you come concerning my wages before you. Every one that is not speckled or spotted among the goats, or dark-colored among the sheep shall be stolen if it is with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said, “Look! Very well. It shall be according to your word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that day he removed the streaked and spotted male goats and all the speckled and spotted female goats, all that had white on it, and every dark-colored ram, and put them in the charge of his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put a journey of three days between him and Jacob, and Jacob pastured the remainder of Laban’s flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob took fresh branches of poplar, almond, and plane trees and peeled white strips on them, exposing the white which was on the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set the branches that he had peeled in front of the flocks, in the troughs and in the water containers. And they were in heat when they came to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the flocks mated by the branches, so the flocks bore streaked, speckled, and spotted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob separated the lambs and turned the faces of the flocks toward the streaked and all the dark-colored in Laban’s flocks. And he put his own herds apart, and did not put them with the flocks of Laban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever any of the stronger of the flocks were in heat, Jacob put the branches in full view of the flock in the troughs that they might mate among the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with the more feeble of the flock he would not put them there. So the feebler were Laban’s and the stronger were Jacob’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man became exceedingly rich and had large flocks, female slaves, male slaves, camels, and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he heard the words of the sons of Laban, saying, “Jacob has taken all that our father has,” and “From that which was our father’s he has gained all this wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob saw the face of Laban and, behold, it was not like it had been in the past.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your ancestors and to your family, and I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field, to his flocks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, “Look, I see the face of your father, that it is not like it has been toward me in the past. But the God of my father is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you yourselves know that I have served your father with all my strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and your father has cheated me and changed my wages ten times, but God has not allowed him to harm me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thus he said, ‘Speckled shall be your wage,’ then all the flock bore speckled. And if he said, ‘Streaked shall be your wage,’ then all the flock bore streaked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has taken away your father’s livestock and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that at the time of the mating of the flock I lifted up my eyes and saw in a dream, and behold, the rams mounting the flock were streaked, speckled, and dappled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of God said to me in the dream, ‘Jacob,’ and I said, ‘Here I am.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘Lift up your eyes and see—all the rams mounting the flock are streaked, speckled, and dappled, for I have seen all that Laban is doing to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the God of Bethel where you anointed a stone pillar, where you made a vow to me. Now get up, go out from this land and return to the land of your birth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rachel and Leah answered and said to him, “Is there yet a portion for us, and an inheritance in the house of our father?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we not regarded as foreigners by him, because he has sold us and completely consumed our money?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the wealth that God has taken away from our father, it belongs to us and to our sons. So now, all that God has said to you, do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob got up and put his children and his wives on the camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he drove all his livestock and his possessions that he had acquired, the livestock of his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-Aram, in order to go to Isaac his father, to the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole the idols that belonged to her father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob tricked Laban the Aramean by not telling him that he intended to flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he fled with all that he had, and arose and crossed the Euphrates and set his face toward the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the third day it was told to Laban that Jacob had fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took his kinsmen with him and pursued after him, a seven-day journey, and he caught up with him in the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Laban the Aramean in a dream at night and said to him, “Take care that you not speak with Jacob, whether good or evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the hill country, and Laban and his kinsmen pitched their tents in the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done that you tricked me and have carried off my daughters like captives of the sword?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you hide your intention to flee and trick me, and did not tell me so that I would have sent you away with joy and song and tambourine and lyre?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why did you not give me opportunity to kiss my grandsons and my daughters goodbye? Now you have behaved foolishly by doing this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is in my power to do harm to you, but the God of your father spoke to me last night saying, ‘Take care from speaking with Jacob, whether good or evil.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, you have surely gone because you desperately longed for the house of your father, but why did you steal my gods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob answered and said to Laban, “Because I was afraid, for I thought, ‘Lest you take your daughters from me by force.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with whomever you find your gods, he shall not live. In the presence of your kinsmen now identify what is with me that is yours and take it.” Now Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban went into Jacob’s tent and Leah’s tent and the tent of the two female servants and did not find his gods. And he came out of Leah’s tent and went into Rachel’s tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rachel had taken the idols and put them in the saddle bag of the camel and sat on them. And Jacob searched the whole tent thoroughly but did not find them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to her father, “Let there not be anger in the eyes of my lord, for I am not able to rise before you, for the way of women is with me. And he searched carefully and did not find the idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob became angry and quarreled with Laban. Jacob answered and said to Laban, “What is my offense? What is my sin that you pursued after me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have searched all my possessions and what did you find among all the possessions of my household? Set it before my kinsmen and your kinsmen that they may decide between the two of us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twenty years I was with you; your ewes and your female goats did not miscarry, and the rams of your flocks I did not eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought no mangled carcass to you—I bore its loss. From my hand you sought it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I was, during the day the heat consumed me, and the cold by night, and my sleep fled from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twenty years I have been in your house. I served you fourteen years for your two daughters and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac had not been with me, indeed now you would have sent me away empty-handed. God saw my misery and the labor of my hands and rebuked you last night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban answered and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters and the grandsons are my grandsons, and the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see, it is mine. Now, what can I do for these my daughters today, or for their children whom they have borne?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, come, let us make a covenant, you and I, and let it be a witness between me and you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob took a stone and set it up as a stone pillar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” And they took stones and made a pile of stones, and they ate there by the pile of stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban called it Jegar Sahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said, “This pile of stones is a witness between me and you today.” Therefore its name is called Galeed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mizpah, because he said, “Yahweh watch between me and you when we are out of sight of each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you mistreat my daughters, and if you take wives besides my daughters, when there is no man with us, see—God is a witness between me and you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban said to Jacob, “See, this pile of stones, and see the pillar that I have set up between me and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This pile of stones is a witness, and the pillar is a witness, that I will not pass beyond this pile of stones to you, and that you will not pass beyond this pile of stones and this pillar to me intending harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, the God of their father judge between us.” Then Jacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob sacrificed a sacrifice on the hill, and he called his kinsmen to eat the meal. And they ate the meal and spent the night on the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban arose early in the morning and kissed his grandsons and his daughters, and blessed them. Then Laban departed and returned to his homeland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob went on his way, and angels of God met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw them, Jacob said, “This is the camp of God!” And he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother, to the land of Seir, the territory of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he instructed them, saying, “Thus you must say to my lord, to Esau, ‘Thus says your servant Jacob, I have dwelled as an alien with Laban, and I have remained there until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have acquired cattle, male donkeys, flocks, and male and female slaves, and I have sent to tell my lord, to find favor in your eyes.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messengers returned to Jacob and said, “We came to your brother, to Esau, and he is coming to meet you, and four hundred men are with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob was very frightened and distressed. So he divided the people, flocks, cattle, and camels that were with him into two companies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he thought, “If Esau comes to one company and destroys it, the remaining company will be able to escape.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, O Yahweh, who said to me, ‘Return to your land and to your family, and I will deal well with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not worthy of all the loyal love and all the faithfulness that you have shown your servant, for with only my staff I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please rescue me from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau, for I fear him, lest he come and attack mother and children alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you yourself said, ‘I will surely deal well with you and make your offspring as the sand of the sea that cannot be counted for abundance.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lodged there that night. Then he took from what he had with him a gift for Esau his brother:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two hundred female goats, twenty male goats, two hundred ewes, twenty rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thirty milk camels with their young, forty cows, ten bulls, twenty female donkeys, and ten male donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put them under the hand of his servants, herd by herd, and said to his servants, “Cross on ahead before me, and put some distance between herds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he instructed the foremost, saying, “When Esau my brother comes upon you and asks you, saying, ‘Whose are you and where are you going? To whom do these animals belong ahead of you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must say, ‘To your servant, to Jacob. It is a gift sent to my lord, to Esau. Now behold, he is also coming after us.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he also instructed the second servant and the third, and everyone else who was behind the herds, saying, “You must speak to Esau according to this word when you find him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And moreover, you shall say, ‘Look, your servant Jacob is behind us.’” For he thought, “Let me appease him with the gift going before me, and afterward I will see his face. Perhaps he will show me favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the gift passed on before him, but he himself spent that night in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That night he arose and took his two wives, his two female servants, and his eleven children and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took them and sent them across the stream. Then he sent across all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob remained alone, and a man wrestled with him until the breaking of the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw that he could not prevail against him, he struck his hip socket, so that Jacob’s hip socket was sprained as he wrestled with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go unless you bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel, for you have struggled with God and with men and have prevailed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob asked and said, “Please tell me your name.” And he said, “Why do you ask this—for my name?” And he blessed him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob called the name of the place Peniel which means “I have seen God face to face and my life was spared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, and he was limping because of his hip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Israelites do not eat the sinew of the sciatic nerve that is upon the socket of the hip unto this day, because he struck the socket of the thigh of Jacob at the sinew of the sciatic nerve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob lifted up his eyes and looked. And behold, Esau was coming and four hundred men were with him. And he divided the children among Leah and among Rachel, and among the two of his female servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the female slaves and their children first, then Leah and her children next, then Rachel with Joseph last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he himself passed on before them and bowed down to the ground seven times until he came to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell upon his neck and kissed him, and they wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau lifted up his eyes and saw the women and the children and said, “Who are these with you?” And he said, “The children whom God has graciously given your servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the female servants drew near, they and their children, and they bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah and her children drew near and bowed down, and afterward Joseph and Rachel drew near and they bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “What do you mean by all this company that I have met?” Then he said, “To find favor in the eyes of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau said, “I have enough my brother; keep what you have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
