verses.text: And Jacob said, “No, please, if I have found favor in your eyes, you must take my gift from my hand, for then I have seen your face which is like seeing the face of God, and you have received me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please take my gift which has been brought to you, for God has dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough.” And he urged him, so he took it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Let us journey and go on, and I will go ahead of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail, and the flocks and the cattle which are nursing are a concern to me. Now if they drove them hard for a day all the flocks would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let my lord pass on before his servant and I will move along slowly at the pace of the livestock that are ahead of me, and at the pace of the children until I come to my lord in Seir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Esau said, “Let me leave some of my people with you.” But he said, “What need is there? Let me find favor in the eyes of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau turned that day on his way to Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob traveled on to Succoth, and he built for himself a house, and he made shelters for his livestock. Therefore he called the name of the place Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob came safely to the city of Shechem which is in the land of Canaan, on his way from Paddan-Aram. And he camped before the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bought a piece of land where he pitched his tent for one hundred pieces of money from the hand of the sons of Hamor, father of Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there he erected an altar and called it “El Elohe Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shechem, the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her. And he took her and lay with her and raped her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his soul clung to Dinah, the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the girl and spoke tenderly to the girl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Shechem said to Hamor his father, saying, “Get this girl for me as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob heard that Dinah his daughter had been defiled, but his sons were with his flocks in the field. And Jacob kept silent until they came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hamor, father of Shechem, went out to Jacob to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it. And the men were distressed and very angry because he had done a disgraceful thing in Israel by having sexual relations with the daughter of Jacob—something that should not be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hamor spoke with them saying, “Shechem my son is in love with your daughter. Please give her to him for a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make marriages with us. Give us your daughters and take our daughters for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall dwell with us and the land shall be before you; settle and trade in it, and acquire property in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shechem said to her father and to her brothers, “Let me find favor in your eyes, and whatever you say to me I will do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make the bride price and gift as high as you like; I will give what you say to me. But give me the girl as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and his father Hamor speaking deceitfully, because he had defiled Dinah their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that is a disgrace for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only on this condition will we give consent to you; if you will become like us—every male among you to be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we will give our daughters to you, and we will take for ourselves your daughters, and we will live with you and become one family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to us, to be circumcised, then we will take our daughters and we will go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their words were good in the eyes of Hamor and in the eyes of Shechem, the son of Hamor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the young man did not delay to do the thing, for he wanted the daughter of Jacob. Now he was the most honored of his father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hamor and his son Shechem came to the gate of their city, and they spoke to the men of their city, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These men are at peace with us. Let them dwell in the land and let them trade in it. Now, behold, the land is broad enough for them. Let us take their daughters as wives, and let us give our daughters to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only on this condition will they give consent to us, to live with us and to become one family—when every male among us is circumcised as they are circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will not their livestock and their property and all their animals be ours? Only let us give consent to them so they will live among us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those who went out of the gate of his city listened to Hamor and Shechem. Every male was circumcised, all those who went out of the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on the third day, while they were in pain, two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, the brothers of Dinah, each took his sword and came against the unsuspecting city and killed all the males.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed Hamor and his son Shechem with the edge of the sword, and they took Dinah from the house of Shechem and went out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took their flocks and their cattle and their donkeys, and whatever was in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured and plundered all that was in the houses—all their wealth, their little ones, and their women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me, making me stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites! I am few in number! If they gather against me and attack me, I will be destroyed—I and my household!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Shall he treat our sister like a prostitute?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there, and make an altar to the God who appeared to you when you fled from before Esau your brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Get rid of the foreign gods that are in your midst and purify yourselves and change your garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let us make ready and let us go up to Bethel, so that I can make an altar there to the God who answered me in the day of my trouble, and who has been with me on the way that I have gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave to Jacob all the foreign gods that were in their hands, and the ornamental rings that were in their ears. And Jacob buried them under the oak which was near Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they set out on their journey, and the terror of God was upon the cities that were all around them, so that they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob came to Luz which was in the land of Canaan (that is Bethel), he and all the people that were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he built an altar there and called the place El-Bethel, for there God had appeared to him when he fled before his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Deborah, the nurse of Rebekah, died. And she was buried below Bethel, under the oak. And its name was called Allon-Bacuth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God appeared to Jacob again when he came from Paddan-Aram, and he blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to him, “Your name is Jacob. Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.” Then his name was called Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to him, “I am El-Shaddai. Be fruitful and multiply. A nation and an assemblage of nations shall be from you, and kings shall go out from your loins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the land that I gave to Abraham and to Isaac, I will give it to you. And to your descendants after you I will give the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God went up from him at the place where he spoke with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob set up a pillar at the place where God had spoken with him, a pillar of stone. And he poured out a drink offering upon it, and poured oil on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob called the name of the place where God had spoken with him Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they journeyed from Bethel. And when they were still some distance from Ephrath, Rachel went into labor. And she had hard labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when her labor was the most difficult the midwife said to her, “Do not be afraid for you have another son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when her life was departing (for she was dying), she called his name Ben-Oni. But his father called him Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rachel died and she was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob erected a pillar at her burial site. That is the pillar of the burial site of Rachel unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel journeyed on and pitched his tent beyond the tower of Eder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And while Israel was living in that land Reuben went and had sexual relations with Bilhah, his father’s concubine. And Israel heard about it.
Now the sons of Jacob were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Leah: The firstborn of Jacob was Reuben. Then Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Bilhah, the female servant of Rachel: Dan and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zilpah, the female servant of Leah: Gad and Asher. These were the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob came to Isaac his father at Mamre, or Kiriath-Arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac dwelled as aliens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the days of Isaac were one hundred and eighty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac passed away and died, and was gathered to his people, old and full of days. And his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the descendants of Esau (that is, Edom).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau took his wives from the daughters of Canaan: Adah, daughter of Elon, the Hittite, and Oholibamah, daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, the Hivite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Basemath, the daughter of Ishmael, the sister of Nebaioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz; and Basemath bore Reuel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Oholibamah bore Jeush and Jalam, and Korah. These are the sons of Esau who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Esau took his wives and his sons and his daughters, and all the persons of his household, and his sheep and goats, and all his cattle, and all the goods that he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to a land away from his brother Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their possessions were too many to live together, so that the land of their sojourning was not able to support them on account of their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau dwelled in the hill country of Seir (Esau, that is Edom).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the descendants of Esau, the father of Edom, in the hill country of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Esau: Eliphaz, the son of Adah, the wife of Esau; Reuel, the son of Basemath, the wife of Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Timnah was the concubine of Eliphaz, the son of Esau. And she bore Amalek to Eliphaz.) These are the sons of Adah, the wife of Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These are the sons of Basemath, the wife of Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, daughter of Zibeon, the wife of Esau: She bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau. The sons of Eliphaz, the firstborn of Esau: the chiefs of Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Korah, Gatam, and Amalek. These are the chiefs of Eliphaz in the land of Edom. These are the sons of Adah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons Reuel, the son of Esau: the chiefs Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These are the chiefs of Reuel in the land of Edom. These are the sons of Basemath, the wife of Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Oholibamah, the wife of Esau: the chiefs Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These are the chiefs born of Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the wife of Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Esau, and these are their chiefs (that is, Edom).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Seir, the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. These are the chiefs of the Horites, the sons of Seir in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam. And Lotan’s sister was Timna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah—he is Anah who found the hot springs in the desert while he pastured the donkeys of Zibeon his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chiefs of the Horites: the chiefs Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. These are the chiefs of the Horites, according to their chiefs in the land of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king ruled over the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom. And the name of his city was Dinhabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bela died, and Jobab, the son of Zerah from Bozrah, reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jobab died, and Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Husham died, and Hadad, son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the field of Moab reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Avith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hadad died, and Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samlah died, and Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shaul died, and Baal-Hanan, the son of Acbor, reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Baal-Hanan the son of Acbor died, and Hadar reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Pau, and the name of his wife was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, daughter of Mezahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the names of the chiefs of Esau according to their families, according to their dwelling places, by their names: the chiefs Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Magdiel, and Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom (that is, Esau, the father of Edom) according to their settlements in the land of their possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob settled in the land of the sojourning of his father, in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was shepherding the flock with his brothers. Now he was a helper with the sons of Bilhah and the sons of Zilpah, the wives of his father. And Joseph brought a bad report of them to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his sons, for he was a son of his old age. And he made a robe with long sleeves for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, they hated him and were not able to speak peaceably to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brothers. And they hated him even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Listen now to this dream that I dreamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, we were binding sheaves in the midst of the field and, behold, my sheaf stood up and it remained standing. Then behold, your sheaves gathered around and bowed down to my sheaf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his brothers said to him, “Will you really rule over us?” And they hated him even more on account of his dream and because of his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he dreamed yet another dream and told it to his brothers. And he said, “Behold, I dreamed a dream again, and behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told it to his father and to his brothers. And his father rebuked him and said to him, “What is this dream that you have dreamed? Will I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow down to the ground to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brothers were jealous of him, but his father kept the matter in mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his brothers went to pasture the flock of their father in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said to Joseph, “Are not your brothers pasturing in Shechem? Come, let me send you to them.” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Go now, see if it goes well for your brothers and for the flock, then return word to me.” And he sent him from the valley of Hebron, and he arrived at Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man found him, and behold, he was wandering about in a field. And the man asked him, “What do you seek?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I am seeking my brothers. Tell me, please, where they are pasturing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man said, “They have moved on from here, for I heard them saying, ‘Let us go to Dothan.’” Then Joseph went after his brothers and found them in Dothan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they saw him from a distance. And before he drew near to them, they conspired against him to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each said to his brothers, “Look, this master of dreams is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, come, let us kill him and throw him in one of the pits. Then we will say a wild animal devoured him. Then we will see what his dreams become.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Reuben heard it and delivered him from their hand and said, “We must not take his life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Reuben said to them, “You must not shed blood. Throw him into this pit that is in the desert, but do not lay a hand on him”—so that he might rescue him from their hand to return him to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as Joseph came to his brothers they stripped Joseph of his robe, the robe with long sleeves, that was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took him and threw him into the pit (the pit was empty; there was no water in it).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat down to eat some food. And they lifted up their eyes and looked, and behold, a caravan of Ishmaelites was coming from Gilead. And their camels were carrying aromatic gum and balm and spices on the way to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to his brothers, “What profit is there if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but our hand shall not be against him, for he is our brother, our own flesh.” And his brothers agreed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Midianite traders passed by. And they drew Joseph up and brought him up from the pit, and they sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver. And they brought Joseph to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Reuben returned to the pit and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit. And he tore his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he returned to his brothers and said, “The boy is gone! Now I, what can I do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took the robe of Joseph and slaughtered a goat, and dipped the robe in the blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sent the robe with long sleeves and they brought it to their father and said, “We found this; please examine it. Is it the robe of your son or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he recognized it and said, “The robe of my son! A wild animal has devoured him! Joseph is surely torn to pieces!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob tore his clothes and put sackcloth on his loins and mourned for his son many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all his sons and daughters tried to console him, but he refused to be consoled. And he said, “No, I shall go down to my son, to Sheol, mourning.” And his father wept for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Midianites sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, a court official of Pharaoh, a commander of the imperial guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that at that time Judah went down from his brothers and pitched his tent near a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah saw the daughter of a certain Canaanite there whose name was Shua. And he took her and went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived and bore a son, and he called his name Er.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again and bore a son, and he called his name Onan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And once again she bore a son, and she called his name Shelah. And he was in Chezib when she bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the eyes of Yahweh, and Yahweh killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to Onan, “Go in to the wife of your brother and perform the duty of a brother-in-law to her, and raise up offspring for your brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Onan knew that the offspring would not be for him, so whenever he went in to the wife of his brother he would waste it on the ground so as not to give offspring to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what he did was evil in the sight of Yahweh, so he killed him also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to Tamar, his daughter-in-law, “Stay a widow in your father’s house until Shelah my son grows up,” for he feared he would also die like his brother. So Tamar went and stayed in the house of her father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the course of time the daughter of Shua, the wife of Judah, died. When Judah was consoled he went up to his sheepshearers, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite, to Timnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told to Tamar, saying, “Look, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she removed the clothes of her widowhood and covered herself with the veil and disguised herself. And she sat at the entrance to Eynayim, which is on the way to Timnah, for she saw that Shelah was grown but she had not been given to him as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah saw her and reckoned her to be a prostitute, for she had covered her face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he turned aside to her at the roadside and said, “Please come, let me come in to you,” for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said, “What will you give to me that you may come in to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I will send a kid from the goats of the flock.” And she said, “Only if you give a pledge until you send it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “What is the pledge that I must give to you?” And she said, “your seal, your cord, and your staff that is in your hand.” And he gave them to her and went in to her. And she conceived by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she arose and left, and she removed her veil from herself and put on the garments of her widowhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah sent the kid from the goats by the hand of his friend the Adullamite to take back the pledge from the hand of the woman, but he could not find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he asked the men of her place, saying, “Where is that cult prostitute that was at Eynayim by the roadside?” And they said, “There is no cult prostitute here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he returned to Judah and said, “I could not find her. Morever, the men of the place said, ‘There is no cult prostitute here.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah said, “Let her take them for herself, lest we be laughed at. Behold, I sent this kid, but you could not find her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about three months later it was told to Judah, “Tamar your daughter-in-law has played the whore, and now, behold, she has conceived by prostitution.” And Judah said, “Bring her out and let her be burned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She was brought out, but she sent to her father-in-law saying, “By the man to whom these belong I have conceived.” And she said, “Now discern to whom these belong: the seal and cord and the staff.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah recognized them and said, “She is more righteous than I, since I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he did not know her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that at the time she gave birth that, behold, twins were in her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that at her labor one child put out a hand. And the midwife took it and tied a crimson thread on his hand saying, “This one came out first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his hand drew back and, behold, his brother came out, and she said, “What a breach you have made for yourself!” And she called his name Perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward his brother who had the crimson thread on his hand came out. And his name was called Zerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph had been brought down to Egypt, and Potiphar, a court official of Pharaoh, commander of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him from the hand of the Ishmaelites who had brought him down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh was with Joseph, and he became a successful man. And he was in the house of his master, the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his master observed that Yahweh was with him, and everything that was in his hand to do Yahweh made successful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph found favor in his eyes and he served him. Then he appointed him over his house and all that he owned he put into his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that from the time he appointed him over his house and over all that he had, Yahweh blessed the house of the Egyptian on account of Joseph. And the blessing of Yahweh was upon all that he had in the house and in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left all that he had in the hand of Joseph, and he did not worry about anything except the food that he ate. Now Joseph was well built and handsome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after these things his master’s wife cast her eyes on Joseph, and she said, “Lie with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he refused and said to his master’s wife, “Look, my master does not worry about what is in the house, and everything he owns he has put in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has no greater authority in this house than me, and he has not withheld anything from me except you, since you are his wife. Now how could I do this great wickedness and sin against God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as she spoke to Joseph day after day, he did not heed her to lie beside her or to be with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one particular day he came into the house to do his work and none of the men of the house were there in the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she seized him by his garment and said, “Lie with me!” And he left his garment in her hand and fled, and he went outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when she saw that he left his garment in her hand and fled outside,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she called to the men of her house and said to them, “Look! He brought a Hebrew man to us to mock us! He came to me to lie with me, and I cried out with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard me, that I raised my voice and called out, he left his garment beside me and fled, and he went outside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she put his garment beside her until his master came to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she spoke to him according to these words, saying, “The Hebrew slave that you brought to us came to me to make fun of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as I raised my voice and called out, he left his garment beside me and fled outside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his master heard the words of his wife that she spoke to him, “This is what your servant did to me,” he became very angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph’s master took him and put him into prison, the place that the king’s prisoners were confined. And he was there in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh was with Joseph, and showed loyal love to him, and gave him favor in the eyes of the chief of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief of the prison put all the prisoners that were in the prison into the hand of Joseph. And everything that was done there, he was the one who did it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief of the prison did not worry about anything in his hand, since Yahweh was with him. And whatever he did Yahweh made it successful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after these things the cupbearer of the king of Egypt and his baker did wrong against their lord, against the king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh was angry with his two officials, with the chief cupbearer and chief baker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put them in custody in the house of the chief of the guard, into the prison where Joseph was confined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief of the guard appointed Joseph to be with them, and he attended them. And they were in custody many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the two of them, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were confined in the prison, dreamed a dream, each his own dream, with its own interpretation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph came to them in the morning he looked at them, and behold, they were troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked the court officials of Pharaoh that were with him in the custody of his master’s house, “Why are your faces sad today?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “We each dreamed a dream, but there is no one to interpret it.” And Joseph said to them, “Do not interpretations belong to God? Please tell them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph, and he said to him, “In my dream, now behold, there was a vine before me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the vine were three branches. And as it budded, its blossoms came up, and its clusters of grapes grew ripe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cup of Pharaoh was in my hand, and I took the grapes and squeezed them into the cup of Pharaoh. Then I placed the cup into the hand of Pharaoh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: The three branches, they are three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In three days Pharaoh will lift up your head and will restore you to your office. And you shall put the cup of Pharaoh into his hand as was formerly the custom, when you were his cupbearer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But remember me when it goes well with you, and please may you show kindness with respect to me, and mention me to Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was surely kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews, and here also I have done nothing that they should put me in this pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good he said to Joseph, “I also dreamed. In my dream, now behold, there were three baskets of bread upon my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the upper basket were all sorts of baked foods for Pharaoh, but the birds were eating them out of the basket upon my head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph answered and said, “This is its interpretation: The three baskets, they are three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In three days Pharaoh will lift your head from you and hang you on a pole, and the birds will eat your flesh from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, he made a feast for all his servants. And he lifted up the head of the chief cupbearer and the head of the chief baker in the midst of his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he restored the chief cupbearer to his cupbearing position. And he placed the cup in the hand of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief baker he hanged as Joseph had interpreted to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after two full years Pharaoh dreamed, and behold, he was standing by the Nile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, seven cows, well built and fat, were coming up from the Nile, and they grazed among the reeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, seven other cows came up after them from the Nile, ugly and gaunt, and they stood beside those cows on the bank of the Nile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ugly and gaunt cows ate the seven well built and fat cows. Then Pharaoh awoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he fell asleep and dreamed a second time, and behold, seven ears of grain, plump and good, were coming out of one stalk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, seven thin ears of grain, scorched by the east wind, sprouted up after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thin ears of grain swallowed up the seven plump and full ears of grain. Then Pharaoh awoke, and behold, it was a dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that in the morning his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called all of the magicians of Egypt, and all its wise men, and Pharaoh told his dream to them. But they had no interpretation for Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief of the cupbearers spoke with Pharaoh, saying, “I remember my sins today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and he put me and the chief baker in the custody of the house of the chief of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we dreamed a dream one night, I and he, each with a dream that had a meaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there with us was a young man, a Hebrew servant of the chief of the guard, and we told him the dream, and he interpreted our dreams for us, each according to his dream he interpreted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened just as he interpreted to us, so it was. He restored me to my office, and him he hanged.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent and called for Joseph, and they brought him quickly from the prison. And he shaved and changed his clothing, and came to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I dreamed a dream, but there is none to interpret it. Now, I have heard concerning you that when you hear a dream you can interpret it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph answered Pharaoh saying, “It is not in my power; God will answer concerning the well-being of Pharaoh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Now in my dream, behold, I was standing on the bank of the Nile,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, seven cows, well built and fat, were coming up from the Nile, and they grazed among the reeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, seven other cows came up after them from the Nile, very ugly and gaunt—never have I seen any as them in all the land of Egypt for ugliness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thin and ugly cows ate the former seven healthy cows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they went into their bellies it could not be known that they went into their bellies, for their appearance was as ugly as at the beginning. Then I awoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw in my dream and behold, seven ears of grain were coming out of one stalk, full and good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, seven withered ears of grain, thin and scorched by the east wind, sprouted up after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thin ears of grain swallowed up the seven good ears of grain. And I told the magicians, but there was none to explain it to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to Pharaoh, “The dreams of Pharaoh are one. God has revealed to Pharaoh what he is about to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven good cows, they are seven years, and the seven good ears of grain, they are seven years. The dreams are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seven thin and ugly cows coming up after them, they are seven years, and the seven empty ears of grain, scorched by the east wind, they are also seven years of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that I have spoken to Pharaoh; God has shown Pharaoh what he is about to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, seven years of great abundance are coming throughout the whole land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then seven years of famine will arise after them, and all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten. The famine will consume the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abundance in the land will not be known because of the famine that follows, for it will be very heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the repetition of the dream twice to Pharaoh, it is because the matter is established by God, and God will do it quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, let Pharaoh select a man who is discerning and wise, and let him set him over the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint supervisors over the land, and let him take one-fifth from the land of Egypt in the seven years of abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let them gather all the food of these coming good years and let them pile up grain under the hand of Pharaoh for food in the cities, and let them keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the food shall be as a deposit for the land for the seven years of the famine that will be in the land of Egypt, that the land will not perish on account of the famine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the plan was good in the eyes of Pharaoh and in the eyes of all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find a man like this in whom is the spirit of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all of this known to you there is no one as discerning and wise as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be over my house, and to your word all my people shall submit. Only with respect to the throne will I be greater than you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh removed his signet ring from his finger and put it on the finger of Joseph. And he clothed him with garments of fine linen, and he put a chain of gold around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he had him ride in his second chariot. And they cried out before him, “Kneel!” And Pharaoh set him over all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh, but without your consent no one will lift his hand or his foot in all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh called the name of Joseph Zaphenath-paneah and gave him Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, as a wife. And Joseph went out over the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh and traveled through the whole land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the land produced a plenty in the seven years of abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gathered all the food of the seven years which occurred in the land of Egypt. And he stored the food in the cities. The food of the field that surrounded each city he stored in its midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph piled up grain like the sand of the sea in great abundance until he stopped counting it, for it could not be counted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the years of famine came, Asenath, daughter of Potiphera priest of On, bore two sons to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh, for he said, “God has caused me to forget all my hardship and all my father’s house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the second he called Ephraim, for he said, “God has made me fruitful in the land of my misfortune.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seven years of abundance which were in the land of Egypt came to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seven years of famine began to come as Joseph had said. And there was famine in all of the countries, but in the land of Egypt there was food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the land of Egypt was hungry the people cried out to Pharaoh for food. And Pharaoh said to all the land of Egypt, “Go to Joseph; what he says to you, you must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the famine was over the whole land, and Joseph opened all the storehouses and sold food to the Egyptians. And the famine was severe in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every land came to Egypt to Joseph to buy grain, for the famine was severe in every land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob realized that there was grain in Egypt, Jacob said to his sons, “Why do you look at one another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Look, I have heard that there is grain in Egypt. Go down there and buy grain for us there that we may live and not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ten brothers of Joseph went down to buy grain from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob did not send Benjamin, the brother of Joseph, for he feared harm would come to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel went to buy grain amid those other people who went as well, for there was famine in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph was the governor over the land. He was the one who sold food to all the people of the land. And the brothers of Joseph came and bowed down to him with their faces to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph saw his brothers and recognized them, but he pretended to be a stranger to them. And he spoke with them harshly and said to them, “From where have you come?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan to buy food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph remembered the dreams which he had dreamed concerning them, and he said to them, “You are spies! You have come to see the nakedness of the land!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “No, my lord, but your servants have come to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We all are sons of one man. We are honest men. We, your servants, are not spies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “No, but you have come to see the nakedness of the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan, but behold, the youngest is with our father today, and one is no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joseph said to them, “It is what I said to you—you are spies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this you shall be tested. By the life of Pharaoh you will not go out from here unless your youngest brother comes here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send one of you, and let him bring your brother, but you will be kept in prison so that your words might be tested to see if there is truth with you. And if not, by the life of Pharaoh surely you are spies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he gathered them into the prison for three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you will live; I fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are honest, let one of your brothers be kept in prison where you are now being kept, but the rest of you go, carry grain for the famine for your households.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must bring your youngest brother to me, and then your words will be confirmed and you will not die.” And they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then each said to his brother, “Surely we are guilty on account of our brother when we saw the anguish of his soul when he pleaded for mercy to us and we would not listen. Therefore this trouble has come to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Reuben answered them, saying, “Did I not say to you, do not sin against the boy? But you did not listen, and now, behold, his blood has been sought.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they did not know that Joseph understood, for the interpreter was between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he turned away from them and wept. Then he returned to them and spoke to them, and took Simeon from them and tied him up in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain and to return their money to each sack, and to give them provisions for the journey. Thus he did for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they loaded their grain upon their donkeys and went away from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them later opened his sack to give fodder to his donkey at the lodging place and saw his money—behold, it was in the mouth of his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his brothers, “My money was returned and moreover, behold, it is in my sack!” Then their hearts failed them and each of them trembled and said, “What is this God has done to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Jacob their father in the land of Canaan they told him everything that had happened to them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The man, the lord of the land, spoke harshly to us and treated us as if we were spying out the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we said to him, ‘We are honest; we are not spies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are twelve brothers, the sons of our father. One is no more and the youngest is with our father now in the land of Canaan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man, the lord of the land, said to us, ‘By this I will know that you are honest. Leave one brother with me, and take food for the famine in your households and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring your youngest brother to me. Then I will know that you are not spies but you are honest. And I will give your brother back to you, and you will trade in the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when they emptied their sacks, behold, each one’s pouch of money was in his sack. And when they and their father saw the pouches of their money, they were greatly distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob their father said to them, “You have bereaved me—Joseph is no more and Simeon is no more, and Benjamin you would take! All of this is against me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my hand and I myself will return him to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “My son shall not go down with you, for his brother is dead and he alone remains. If harm meets him on the journey that you would take, you would bring down my gray head in sorrow to Sheol.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the famine in the land was severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as they finished eating the grain which they had brought from Egypt their father said to them, “Return and buy a little food for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to him, “The man solemnly admonished us, saying, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will send our brother with us, we will go down and buy food for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if you will not send him, we will not go down, for the man said to us, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said, “Why did you bring trouble to me by telling the man you still had a brother?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “The man asked explicitly about us and about our family, saying, ‘Is your father still alive? Do you have a brother?’ And we answered him according to these words. How could we know that he would say, ‘Bring down your brother’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy with me, and let us arise and go, so that we will live and not die—you, we, and our children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will be surety for him. You may seek him from my hand. If I do not bring him back to you and present him before you, then I will stand guilty before you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely if we had not hesitated by this time we would have returned twice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so then do this. Take some of the best products of the land in your bags and take them down to the man as a gift—a little balm and honey, aromatic gum and myrrh, and pistachios and almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And take double the money in your hands. Take back the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks. Perhaps it was a mistake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And take your brother. Now arise and return to the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And may El-Shaddai grant you compassion before the man that he may release your other brother to you and Benjamin. As for me, if I am bereaved, I am bereaved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men took this gift, and they took double money in their hands, and Benjamin, and they rose up and went down to Egypt and stood before Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them he said to the one who was over his household, “Bring the men into the house and slaughter and prepare an animal, for the men shall eat with me at noon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man did as Joseph had said, and the man brought the men into the house of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men were afraid when they were brought into the house of Joseph. And they said “We were brought here on account of the money that was returned to our sacks the first time, that he might attack us and fall upon us to take us as slaves with our donkeys.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they approached the man who was over Joseph’s house and spoke to him at the doorway of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Please, my lord, we surely came down once before to buy food,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when we came to the place of lodging and we opened our sacks, then behold, each one’s money was in the mouth of his sack—our money in its full weight—so we have returned with it in our hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, other money we have brought down in our hand to buy food. We do not know who put our money in our sacks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Peace to you; do not be afraid. Your God and the God of your father must have given you a treasure in your sacks; your money came to me.” And he brought Simeon out to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man brought the men into Joseph’s house and he gave them water and washed their feet, and gave fodder to their donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they laid out the gift until Joseph came at noon, for they had heard that they were to eat food there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Joseph came into the house they brought the gift that was in their hand into the house to him, and they bowed down before him to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he greeted them and said, “Is your father well, the old man of whom you spoke? Is he still alive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Your servant our father is well; he is still alive.” And they knelt and bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he lifted up his eyes and saw Benjamin his brother, the son of his mother, and said, “Is this your youngest brother of whom you told me?” And he continued, “God be gracious to you, my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph hurried away, being overcome with emotion toward his brother, and sought for a place to cry. Then he went into a room and wept there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he washed his face and went out, now controlling himself, and said, “Serve the food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who were eating with him by themselves, for Egyptians could not dine with Hebrews, because that was a detestable thing to Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were seated before him from the firstborn according to his birthright to the youngest according to his youth. And the men looked at one another amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And portions were served to them from his table, and the portion of Benjamin was five times greater than the portion of any of them. And they drank and became drunk with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded the one who was over his household, saying, “Fill the sacks of the men with food as much as they are able to carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my cup—the cup of silver—you shall put into the mouth of the sack of the youngest, and the money for his grain. And he did according to the word of Joseph that he had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the morning light came the men were sent away, they and their donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out of the city, and had not gone far when Joseph said to the one who was over his house, “Arise! Pursue after the men and overtake them. Then you shall say to them, ‘Why have you repaid evil for good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this not that from which my master drinks? Now he himself certainly practices divination with it. You have done evil in what you have done.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he overtook them he spoke these words to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Why has my lord spoken according to these words? Far be it from your servants to do such a thing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the money that we found in the mouth of our sacks we returned to you from the land of Canaan. Now why would we steal silver or gold from the house of my lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is found with it from among your servants shall die. And moreover, we will become slaves to my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Now also according to your words, thus will it be. He who is found with it shall be my slave, but you shall be innocent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then each man quickly brought down his sack to the ground, and each one opened his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he searched, beginning with the oldest and finishing with the youngest. And the cup was found in the sack of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they tore their clothes, and each one loaded his donkey and they returned to the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah and his brothers came to the house of Joseph—now he was still there—they fell before him to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Did you not know that a man who is like me surely practices divination?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah said, “What can we say to my lord? What can we speak? Now how can we show ourselves innocent? God has found the guilt of your servants! Behold, we are slaves to my lord, both we and also he in whose hand the cup was found.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Far be it from me to do this! The man in whose hand the cup was found, he will become my slave. But as for you, go up in peace to your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Judah drew near to him and said, “Please my lord, let your servant speak a word in the ears of my lord, and let not your anger burn against your servant, for you are like Pharaoh himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My lord had asked his servants, saying, ‘Do you have a father or a brother?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we said to my lord, ‘We have an aged father, and a younger brother, the child of his old age, and his brother died, and he alone remains from his mother, and his father loves him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me that I may set my eyes upon him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father; if he should leave his father, then he would die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you shall not again see my face.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that we went up to your servant, my father, and told him the words of my lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when our father said, ‘Buy a little food for us,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then we said, ‘We cannot go down. If our youngest brother is with us, then we shall go down. For we will not be able to see the face of the man unless our youngest brother is with us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then your servant, my father, said to us, ‘You yourselves know that my wife bore two sons to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One went out from me, and I said, “Surely he must have been torn to pieces,” and I have never seen him since.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you take this one also from me, and he encounters harm, you will bring down my gray head in sorrow to Sheol.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, when I come to your servant, my father, and the boy is not with us—now his life is bound up with his life—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it shall happen that when he sees that the boy is gone, he will die. And your servants will bring down the gray head of your servant, our father, to Sheol with sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your servant is pledged as surety for the boy by my father, saying, If I do not bring him to you, then I shall be culpable to my father forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, please let your servant remain in place of the boy as a slave to my lord, and let the boy go up with his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how can I go up to my father if the boy is not with me? I do not want to see the misery which will find my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph was not able to control himself before all who were standing by him. And he cried out, “Make every man go out from me!” So no one stood with him when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wept loudly, so that the Egyptians heard it and the household of Pharaoh heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?” And his brothers were unable to answer him, for they were dismayed at his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph said to his brothers, “Come near to me, please.” And they drew near. And he said, “I am Joseph, your brother, whom you sold into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, do not be distressed and do not be angry with yourselves that you sold me here, for God sent me as deliverance before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these two years the famine has been in the midst of the land, but there will be five more years where there is no plowing or harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent me before you all to preserve for you a remnant in the land and to keep alive among you many survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, you yourselves did not send me here, but God put me here as father to Pharaoh and as master of all his household, and a ruler over all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hurry, and go up to my father and say to him, ‘Thus says your son Joseph, God has made me lord of all Egypt. Come down to me and do not delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall settle in the land of Goshen so that you will be near me, you and your children and your grandchildren, and your flocks and your herds and all that you have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will provide for you there, because there are still five years of famine—lest you and your household and all that you have become destitute.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin see, that it is I who am speaking to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must tell my father of all my honor in Egypt and all that you have seen. Now hurry and bring my father here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he fell upon the neck of his brother Benjamin and wept, and Benjamin wept upon his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he kissed all his brothers and wept upon them. And afterward his brothers spoke with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the report was heard in the house of Pharaoh, saying, “Joseph’s brothers have come.” And it pleased Pharaoh and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers: ‘Do this—load your donkeys and go back to the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and take your father and your households and come to me, and I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and you shall eat the fat of the land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you Joseph, are commanded to say this: ‘Do this! Take wagons from the land of Egypt for your little ones and your wives, and bring your father and come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not worry about your possessions, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel did so. And Joseph gave them wagons at the word of Pharaoh, and gave them provisions for the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To each and to all of them he gave sets of clothing, but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and five sets of clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to his father he sent as follows: ten donkeys carrying the best of Egypt, and ten donkeys carrying grain and food and provisions for his father for the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent his brothers away, and when they departed he said to them, “Do not be agitated on the journey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up from Egypt and came to the land of Canaan to Jacob their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spoke to him, saying, “Joseph is still alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt.” And his heart went numb, because he did not believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told him all the words of Joseph that he had spoken to them. And when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to carry him, then the spirit of Jacob their father revived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said, “It is enough. Joseph my son is still alive. I will go and see him before I die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel journeyed with all that he had, and he came to Beersheba and offered sacrifices to the God of his father, Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke to Israel in visions of the night and said, “Jacob, Jacob.” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “I am the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for I will make you a great nation there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I myself will also bring you up. And Joseph will place his hand over your eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob arose from Beersheba. And the sons of Israel carried their father Jacob, and their little ones and their wives in the wagons Pharaoh had sent to transport him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took their livestock and their possessions that they had acquired in the land of Canaan. And they came to Egypt, Jacob and all his offspring with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his sons and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters and his daughters’ daughters with him, into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons. Reuben, the firstborn of Jacob
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Reuben: Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah (but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan). And the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar: Tolah, Puvah, Iob, and Shimron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Leah that she bore to Jacob in Paddan-Aram, and Dinah his daughter. His sons and daughters were thirty-three persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah, and their sister Serah. And the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malkiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter, and she bore these to Jacob—sixteen persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Rachel, Jacob’s wife: Joseph and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ephraim and Manasseh, whom Asenath, daughter of Potiphera, priest of On bore to him, were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Beker, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Rachel who were born to Jacob—fourteen persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Dan: Hushim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Bilhah whom Laban gave to Rachel his daughter, and she bore these to Jacob—seven persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the persons belonging to Jacob who came to Egypt who were his descendants, not including the wives of the sons of Jacob were sixty-six persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Joseph who were born to him in Egypt were two persons. All the persons of the house of Jacob who came to Egypt were seventy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph to appear before him in Goshen. And they came to the land of Goshen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph harnessed his chariot and went up to meet Israel his father in Goshen. He presented himself to him and fell upon his neck and wept upon his neck a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Now let me die since I have seen your face, for you are still alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and report to Pharaoh, and I will say to him, ‘My brothers and my father’s household who were in the land of Canaan have come to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men are shepherds, for they are men of livestock, and they have brought their flocks and their cattle and all that they have.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be that when Pharaoh calls you he will say, ‘What is your occupation?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must say, ‘You servants are men of livestock from our childhood until now, both we and also our ancestors,’ so that you may dwell in the land of Goshen, for every shepherd is a detestable thing to Egyptians.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph went and reported to Pharaoh. And he said, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and their herds, and all that they have, have come from the land of Canaan. Now they are here in the land of Goshen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from among his brothers he took five men and presented them before Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” And they said to Pharaoh, “Your servants are keepers of sheep, both we and also our ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to Pharaoh, “We have come to sojourn in the land, for there is no pasture for your servant’s flocks, for the famine is severe in the land of Canaan. So now, please let your servants dwell in the land of Goshen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Your father and your brothers have come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Egypt is before you. Settle your father and your brothers in the best of the land. Let them live in the land of Goshen, and if you know there is among them men of ability, then appoint them overseers of my own livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph brought his father Jacob and presented him before Pharaoh. And Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Jacob, “How old are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to Pharaoh, “The days of the years of my sojourning are one hundred and thirty years. Few and hard have been the days of the years of my life, and they have not reached the days of the years of the lives of my ancestors in the days of their sojourning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and he went out from the presence of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph settled his father and his brothers, and he gave them property in the land of Egypt in the best part of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had instructed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph provided his father and his brothers and all the household of his father with food, according to the number of their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was no food in all the land, for the famine was very severe. And the land of Egypt languished, with the land of Canaan, on account of the famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph collected all the money found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan in exchange for the grain that they were buying. And Joseph brought the money into the house of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the money was spent in the land of Egypt and from the land of Canaan, all of Egypt came to Joseph, saying, “Give us food! Why should we die before you? For the money is used up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph said, “Give your livestock and I will give you food in exchange for your livestock if your money is used up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought their herds to Joseph, and Joseph gave food to them in exchange for horses, their flocks, and their cattle and donkeys. And he provided them with food in exchange for all their livestock that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When that year ended, they came to him in the following year and said to him, “We cannot hide from my lord that our money and livestock belong to my lord. Nothing remains before my lord except our bodies and our land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should we die in front of you, both we and our land? Buy us and our land in exchange for food, then we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh. Then give us seed and we shall live and not die, and the land will not become desolate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh, for each Egyptian sold his field, for the famine was severe upon them. And the land became Pharaoh’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the people, he transferred them to the cities, from one end of the territory of Egypt to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the land of the priests he did not buy, for there was an allotment for the priests from Pharaoh, and they lived on the allotment that Pharaoh gave to them. Therefore they did not sell their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph said to the people, “Look, I have bought you and your land this day for Pharaoh. Here is seed for you so you can sow the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall happen that at the harvest, you must give a fifth to Pharaoh and four-fifths shall be yours, as seed for the field and for your food and for those who are in your households, and as food for your little ones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
