verses.text: And they said, “You have saved our lives. If we have found favor in the eyes of my lord, we will be servants to Pharaoh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph made it a statute unto this day concerning the land of Egypt: one fifth to Pharaoh. Only the land of the priests alone did not belong to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel settled in the land of Egypt, in the land of Goshen. And they acquired possessions in it and were fruitful and multiplied greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years. And the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were one hundred and forty-seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time of Israel’s death drew near, he called to his son, to Joseph. And he said to him, “If I have found favor in your eyes, please put your hand under my thigh, that you might vow to deal kindly and faithfully with me. Please do not bury me in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but let me lie with my ancestors. Carry me out of Egypt and bury me in their burial site.” And he said, “I will do according to your word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Swear to me.” And he swore to him. Then Israel bowed himself on the head of the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after these things, it was said to Joseph, “Behold, your father is ill.” And he took his two sons with him, Ephraim and Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told to Jacob, “Behold, your son Joseph has come to you.” Then Israel strengthened himself and he sat up in the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Joseph, “El-Shaddai appeared to me in Luz, in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to me, ‘Behold, I will make you fruitful and make you numerous, and will make you a company of nations. And I will give this land to your offspring after you as an everlasting possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, your two sons who were born to you in the land of Egypt before my coming to you in Egypt, are mine. Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine as Reuben and Simeon are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your children whom you father after them shall be yours. By the name of their brothers they shall be called, with respect to their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, when I came to Paddan-Aram Rachel died to my sorrow in the land of Canaan on the way when there was still some distance to go to Ephrath. And I buried her there on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel saw the sons of Joseph he said, “Who are these?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons whom God has given me here.” And he said, “Please bring them to me that I may bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the eyes of Israel were dim on account of old age; he was not able to see. So he brought them near to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said to Joseph, “I did not expect to see your face and behold, God has also shown me your offspring.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph removed them from his knees and bowed down with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph took the two of them, Ephraim at his right to the left of Israel, and Manasseh at his left to the right of Israel. And he brought them near to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel stretched out his right hand and put it on the head of Ephraim (now he was the younger), and his left hand on the head of Manasseh, crossing his hands, for Manasseh was the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he blessed Joseph and said,
“The God before whom my fathers, Abraham and Isaac, walked,
    The God who shepherded me all my life unto this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel who redeemed me from all evil,
    may he bless the boys.
And through them let my name be perpetuated,
    and the name of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac.
And let them multiply into many in the midst of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph saw that his father put his right hand on the head of Ephraim, he was displeased. And he took hold of his father’s hand to remove it from the head of Ephraim over to the head of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph said to his father, “Not so, my father; because this one is the firstborn. Put your right hand upon his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his father refused and said, “I know, my son; I know. He also shall become a people, and he also shall be great, but his younger brother shall be greater than him, and his offspring shall become a multitude of nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he blessed them that day, saying,
Through you Israel shall pronounce blessing, saying,
‘May God make you like Ephraim and like Manasseh.’”
So he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said to Joseph, “Behold, I am about to die, but God will be with you and will bring you back to the land of your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have given to you one slope of land rather than your brothers, which I took from the hand of the Amorites by my sword and with my bow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob called his sons and said, “Gather together so that I can tell you what will happen with you in days to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assemble and hear, O sons of Jacob!
    Listen to Israel your father!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Reuben, you are my firstborn,
    my strength, and the firstfruit of my vigor,
    excelling in rank and excelling in power.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let not my person be joined to their company.
    For in their anger they killed men,
    and at their pleasure they hamstrung cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be their anger, for it is fierce,
    and their wrath, for it is cruel.
I will divide them in Jacob,
    and I will scatter them in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah, as for you, your brothers shall praise you.
    Your hand shall be on the neck of your enemies.
    The sons of your father shall bow down to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah is a lion’s cub.
    From the prey, my son, you have gone up.
He bowed down; he crouched like a lion and as a lioness.
    Who shall rouse him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
    nor the ruler’s staff between his feet,
until Shiloh comes.
    And to him shall be the obedience of nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Binding his donkey to the vine
    and his donkey’s colt to the choice vine,
he washes his clothing in the wine
    and his garment in the blood of grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes are darker than wine,
    and the teeth whiter than milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zebulun shall settle by the shore of the sea.
    He shall become a haven for ships,
    and his border shall be at Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Issachar is a strong donkey,
    crouching between the sheepfolds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He saw a resting place that was good,
    and land that was pleasant.
So he bowed his shoulder to the burden
    and became a servant of forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dan shall judge his people
    as one of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dan shall be a serpent on the way,
    a viper on the road
that bites the heels of a horse,
    so that its rider falls backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wait for your salvation, O Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bandits shall attack Gad,
    but he shall attack their heels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Asher’s food is delicious,
    and he shall provide from the king’s delicacies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Naphtali is a doe running free
    that puts forth beautiful words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joseph is the bough of a fruitful vine,
    a fruitful bough by a spring.
    His branches climb over the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The archers fiercely attacked him.
    They shot arrows at him and were hostile to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But his bow remained in a steady position;
    his arms were made agile
by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob.
    From there is the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the God of your father he will help you
    and by Shaddai he will bless you
    with the blessings of heaven above,
blessings of the deep that crouches beneath,
    blessings of the breasts and the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessings of your father
    are superior to the blessings of my ancestors,
    to the bounty of the everlasting hills.
May they be on the head of Joseph,
    and on the forehead of the prince of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Benjamin is a devouring wolf,
    devouring the prey in the morning,
    and dividing the plunder in the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father said to them when he blessed them, each according to their blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he instructed them and said to them, “I am about to be gathered to my people. Bury me among my ancestors in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah that is before Mamre in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite as a burial site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife. There they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife. And there I buried Leah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the purchase of the field and the cave which was in it from the Hittites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob finished instructing his sons he drew his feet up to the bed. Then he took his last breath and was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph fell on the face of his father and wept upon him and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph instructed his servants the physicians to embalm his father. So the physicians embalmed Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forty days were required for it, for thus are the days required for embalming. And the Egyptians wept for him seventy days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of his weeping had passed, Joseph spoke to the household of Pharaoh, saying, “If I have found favor in your eyes, please speak in the hearing of Pharaoh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘My father made me swear, saying, “Behold, I am about to die. In the tomb that I have hewed out for myself in the land of Canaan—there you must bury me.” So then, please let me go up and let me bury my father; then I will return.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father as he made you swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph went up to bury his father. And all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his household, and all the elders of the land of Egypt, went up with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all the household of Joseph, his brothers, and the household of his father. They left only their little children and their flocks and their herds in the land of Goshen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there also went up with him chariots and horsemen. The company was very great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the threshing floor of Atad, which was beyond the Jordan, they lamented there with a very great and sorrowful wailing. And he made a mourning ceremony for his father seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land, saw the mourning ceremony at the threshing floor of Atad they said, “This is a severe mourning for the Egyptians.” Therefore its name was called Abel-Mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus his sons did to him just as he had instructed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sons carried him to the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which field Abraham had bought as a burial site from Ephron the Hittite before Mamre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the brothers of Joseph saw that their father was dead, they said, “It may be that Joseph will hold a grudge against us and pay us back dearly for all the evil that we did to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sent word to Joseph saying, “Your father commanded us before his death, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you must say to Joseph, ‘O, please now forgive the transgression of your brothers and their sin, for they did evil to you.’ So now, please forgive the transgression of the servants of the God of your father.” And Joseph wept when they spoke to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his brothers went also and fell before him and said, “Behold, we are your servants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to them, “Do not be afraid, for am I in the place of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, you planned evil against me, but God planned it for good, in order to do this—to keep many people alive—as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, do not be afraid. I myself will provide for you and your little ones. And he consoled them and spoke kindly to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph remained in Egypt, he and the house of his father. And Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph saw Ephraim’s children to the third generation. Moreover, the children of Makir, son of Manasseh, were born on the knees of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die, but God will certainly visit you and bring you up from this land to the land that he swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph made the sons of Israel swear an oath, saying, “God will surely visit you, and you shall bring up my bones from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph died, being one hundred and ten years old. They embalmed him and he was placed in a coffin in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
